[{'created': '2018-09-06 18:51:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add ``insecure`` and ``cacert`` options to the client.

The client does support SSL authentication through keystoneauth right now. In
CLI mode, this is done through the "--os-cert" and "--os-cacert" options, or
through environment variables.

However, when the client is used as a python library,this is done through
requests' "verify" parameter, which is not very explicit.

This adds two parameters to the client

Change-Id: I68969c658724f53c85c47ab6098a3e2165f5925d
Story: 2003689
Task: 26224
'}]
commit_message:
Add ``insecure`` and ``cacert`` options to the client.

The client does support SSL authentication through keystoneauth right now. In
CLI mode, this is done through the "--os-cert" and "--os-cacert" options, or
through environment variables.

However, when the client is used as a python library,this is done through
requests' "verify" parameter, which is not very explicit.

This adds two parameters to the client

Change-Id: I68969c658724f53c85c47ab6098a3e2165f5925d
Story: 2003689
Task: 26224

commit_message:
PodVIFDriver impl - fix release_vif() signature

Some of the implementations of PodVIFDriver do not have the project_id
and security_groups parameters, resulting in runtime exceptions if these
drivers are used with handlers that expect base class signature to be
followed.

Change-Id: Id1972e02f71238771062cdebec37a3a8a22d768b
Closes-Bug: 1787918
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>
(cherry picked from commit b52f8204a868817fd81e8c57e30b9904bdc080e2)

commit_message:
Switch test runner to django default runner

nose is not actively maintained now and Django default test runner
seems to have enough features.

* Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
  This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.
  The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
  so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.
* Integraion tests is marked via django.test.tag mechanism which is
  introduced in Django 1.10.
* Rename filename of test files to names starting with 'test_'
  so that the django test runner can find tests expectedly.

Change-Id: I51373a7df9686e894f5deed34db955189299fa77

[{'created': '2018-09-06 06:50:40.000000000', 'message': "OCP-Router - Fix Ingress controller LB listener creation

After the changes done at LBaaS driver to support
namespace network isolation Ingress controller fails to
create/ensure Listener for the L7 Router LB.

This patch fixes this issue, and also update ingress controller
code to retrieve L7 router's LB details in the context of

Closes-Bug: 1787883

commit_message:
OCP-Router - Fix Ingress controller LB listener creation

After the changes done at LBaaS driver to support
namespace network isolation Ingress controller fails to
create/ensure Listener for the L7 Router LB.

This patch fixes this issue, and also update ingress controller
code to retrieve L7 router's LB details in the context of
the working thread.

Closes-Bug: 1787883

Change-Id: Ia63785bdc9018f8ecd3ad820bb484f34c48e9569
(cherry picked from commit 831ee03d6fc3319e54f246ba64643cdecbbbf403)

[{'created': '2018-09-06 06:40:08.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ports pool are not duplicated with kuryr-controller HA

Due to ports pool being on kuryr-controller memory, there is a need
for sync-ing the pools when a kuryr-controller becomes the active
controller, otherwise pools created by the previous active controller
will not be used and new ports will be created. This patch ensures
the kuryr-controller triggers a ports pool recovery action when
transitioning to the active controller

Closes-Bug: 1787595
Change-Id: I8ee48f8cf4afad2338ae7a3b55b99ce46910ad70
(cherry picked from commit 860896601e35c4676b238e6ca6e85534d7532b43)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure ports pool are not duplicated with kuryr-controller HA

Due to ports pool being on kuryr-controller memory, there is a need
for sync-ing the pools when a kuryr-controller becomes the active
controller, otherwise pools created by the previous active controller
will not be used and new ports will be created. This patch ensures
the kuryr-controller triggers a ports pool recovery action when
transitioning to the active controller

Closes-Bug: 1787595
Change-Id: I8ee48f8cf4afad2338ae7a3b55b99ce46910ad70
(cherry picked from commit 860896601e35c4676b238e6ca6e85534d7532b43)

commit_message:
PodVIFDriver impl - fix release_vif() signature

Some of the implementations of PodVIFDriver do not have the project_id
and security_groups parameters, resulting in runtime exceptions if these
drivers are used with handlers that expect base class signature to be
followed.

Change-Id: Id1972e02f71238771062cdebec37a3a8a22d768b
Closes-Bug: 1787918
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>
(cherry picked from commit b52f8204a868817fd81e8c57e30b9904bdc080e2)

> What will be the best way to verify this patch?

Taking a given NP (http://paste.openstack.org/show/727484/) Which I'll use for the upcoming tempest tests you can do the following steps:

1) Enable policy driver on kuryr CM
2) Enable the network policy: kubectl apply -f network_policy.yml

After this you should see that there are three new objects
-1) kuryrnetpolicy (check with kubectl get kuryrnetpolicies)
-2) networkpolicy (ditto with networkpolicies)
-3) OS security group

Now let's test the teardown:
1) kubectl delete -f network_policy.yml
2) All prior resources should now be teared down.

Thanks for checking it!"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-08-07 10:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 10:11:56.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] [DNM] Implement NP driver actions

This commit implements NP driver actions for creating/updating SG and SG
rules. It also creates KuryrNetPolicy as a CRD so we don't have to relay
on the slow neutron API for time-costly operations such as listing SG
and so.

commit_message:
Implement NP SG create/delete actions

This commit implements NP driver actions for creating/updating SG and SG
rules. It also creates KuryrNetPolicy as a CRD so we don't have to rely
on the slow neutron API for time-costly operations such as listing SG
and so.

Security group rules and label matching will be handled in a follow-up
patch, as well as storing CRD object_id in a network policy annotation.

Unit tests will also be added after some more functionality is added
with the remaining patch series.

Partially-Implements: bp/k8s-network-policies
Change-Id: I6d45a462e812b24073b529144fc0843e8725a06e

commit_message:
Add templates for modal forms

Modal forms need to use templates which extend the default modal form
template of Horizon.
New templates have a description paragraph too.

Task: 23260
Story: 2003138
Closes-Bug: 1749249
Change-Id: Ia2451892d5bf84e1a4bdfea808b9275cba669a17

[{'created': '2018-07-06 12:35:24.000000000', 'message': 'Improve CloudKitty's dashboard

Work items:

     - The "Project/Rating" tab has been improved: it does now provide a total
       by metric type. This make use of the /summary endpoint instead of /total
       (/total is deprecated).

     - An "Admin/Rating Summary" tab has been added. An admin user can now have
       the cost of every rated tenant at once. By clicking on a tenant, a
       per-resource total for the given tenant can be obtained (this view is
       similar to the "Project/Rating" tab). A per-resource total for the whole
       cloud is also available.

Change-Id: I13b9ba9e04a330ec216378258ad024c8651f6ff5

commit_message:
Improve CloudKitty's dashboard

Work items:

     - The "Project/Rating" tab has been improved: it does now provide a total
       by metric type. This make use of the /summary endpoint instead of /total
       (/total is deprecated).

     - An "Admin/Rating Summary" tab has been added. An admin user can now have
       the cost of every rated tenant at once. By clicking on a tenant, a
       per-resource total for the given tenant can be obtained (this view is
       similar to the "Project/Rating" tab). A per-resource total for the whole
       cloud is also available.

Change-Id: I13b9ba9e04a330ec216378258ad024c8651f6ff5

commit_message:
Consider interface and region options with OSC

The --os-interface/OS_INTERFACE and --os-region-name/OS_REGION_NAME
options were considered by cloudkitty CLI but ignored when using the OSC
integration.

Change-Id: I36dc3616fba59c9b2e77da75abe0f76db7ddb7e4

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I5bf9001a7030c7f650e3eb517f8c1095516aef8a
Story: #2002586
Task: #24344

commit_message:
Remove the unused attributes in the tables

The delete actions inherits from tables.DeleteAction,
the tables.DeleteAction has already define the icon attribute.
So this patch remove the repeated attributes for cleanup.

Change-Id: I34f94e0951589f4ab4181a2f80abba6cc5506f9e

messages:
[{'account_id': 28543, 'date': '2018-08-23 08:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-24 02:47:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

qinling starts to do official release since Rocky, so don't need to do anything for previous branches."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-28 09:55:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You need to import a zuul.yaml file, otherwise you will not be able to merge anything.

It's fine to change this to disable the failing job if you like..."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-28 09:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-28 10:01:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-28 10:53:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Let'S remove build-sphinx-docs from project-config to merge this. Lingxian, will you propose a change?"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-28 12:54:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Let'S remove build-sphinx-docs from project-config to merge this.
 > Lingxian, will you propose a change?

Hi Andreas, I'm wondering if we could just abandon this patch because Qinling team is not going to merge anything back to that branch. I created that branch before just for the milestone reference. if it's not possible, I can definitely propose a change in project-config."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-28 12:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Best to discuss with Doug what to do here...'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-28 14:02:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Let'S remove build-sphinx-docs from project-config to merge this.
 > > Lingxian, will you propose a change?
 > 
 > Hi Andreas, I'm wondering if we could just abandon this patch
 > because Qinling team is not going to merge anything back to that
 > branch. I created that branch before just for the milestone
 > reference. if it's not possible, I can definitely propose a change
 > in project-config.

If you're not going to maintain the pike branch, you can abandon this patch."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-28 14:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > Let'S remove build-sphinx-docs from project-config to merge
 > this.
 > > > Lingxian, will you propose a change?
 > >
 > > Hi Andreas, I'm wondering if we could just abandon this patch
 > > because Qinling team is not going to merge anything back to that
 > > branch. I created that branch before just for the milestone
 > > reference. if it's not possible, I can definitely propose a
 > change
 > > in project-config.
 > 
 > If you're not going to maintain the pike branch, you can abandon
 > this patch.

You could also contact the stable maintenance team (via the mailing list) about closing the branch as EOL to avoid any confusion in the future."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-07 07:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-07 07:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

this is the final change for python3-first goal - please approve'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-09-07 08:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

thanks Andreas for your help'}]

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Also, remove tools/tox_install.sh - it is not needed and breaks docs
building.

Change-Id: I8014b4044077347e010eeb6ddb7577d7ca282abe
Story: #2002586
Task: #24326

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id42d6b6e59ad35e7dc51db5fbc3c483ba8e794f9
Story: #2002586
Task: #24336

Because we are reverse proxying PyPI, there is no reason to keep
the mirroring information in the AFS dashboard.

outdated.

commit_message:
Remove references to pypi mirroring from dashboard

Because we are reverse proxying PyPI, there is no reason to keep
the mirroring information in the AFS dashboard.

It is confusing, as it leads to thinking the pypi mirrors are
outdated.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597399/

Change-Id: Ic01f40cea16d82ad49fcde5bf329aedb43aac2d0

commit_message:
Refactor non-docker upload functions into base class

This is in preparation for a SkopeoImageUploader which won't need to
create a docker client for any operations.

Change-Id: Idc2fa7d6d1c5ec0c43c5b81a9dfa6b64235195f0

commit_message:
No need to compare CONF content

When setup AuthProtocol class, if the CONF object contains
deprecated options, An Error "dictionary changed size during
iteration" will raise when comparing the CONF content.

Changing "!=" to "is not" here to avoid compare the CONF
content anymore.

Change-Id: I820aa244160db4f81149d2576386c86b46de0084
Closes-bug: #1789351

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 22:30:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix TypeError in nova-manage cell_v2 list_cells

Cell mappings don't require a name, so when listing
cells, if any mappings don't have a name, the sorted
function will fail with a TypeError since you can't compare
None to a string.

This fixes the issue by using the empty string if the cell
mapping name is None.

Change-Id: I4fc9d8d1a96f1ec722c2c92dead3f5c4c94d4382
Closes-Bug: #1790695
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in nova-manage cell_v2 list_cells

Cell mappings don't require a name, so when listing
cells, if any mappings don't have a name, the sorted
function will fail with a TypeError since you can't compare
None to a string.

This fixes the issue by using the empty string if the cell
mapping name is None.

Change-Id: I4fc9d8d1a96f1ec722c2c92dead3f5c4c94d4382
Closes-Bug: #1790695

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I91a606d98b128eb980ea0e5ea53a2f0446ae77f7
Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

commit_message:
Delete the unnecessary empty mode check

the mode is handled by oslo.config [0][1], and it
could't be empty, the if condition is unnessary,
this patch to remove it.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/common/config.py#L77
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/common/config.py#L113

Change-Id: Ia1ca9caa6a4cb97bc376b8a01aeb6f175cf87330

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 08:33:58.000000000', 'message': "Make nova tests less strict

When calling nova's server list, the list of instances aren't guaranteed
to be in a particular order, so the order in which the mocked backup
calls happens is nondeterministic and results in flaky tests. This
affects packagers who run these tests on every package build. Use
any_order=True to make the tests more flexible.

Change-Id: I85edb41e77cc66a6b8dd5c86cbefb22ed61e2700
"}]
commit_message:
Make nova tests less strict

When calling nova's server list, the list of instances aren't guaranteed
to be in a particular order, so the order in which the mocked backup
calls happens is nondeterministic and results in flaky tests. This
affects packagers who run these tests on every package build. Use
any_order=True to make the tests more flexible.

Change-Id: I85edb41e77cc66a6b8dd5c86cbefb22ed61e2700

commit_message:
Fix arguments to Eventlet WSGI initializer

In eventlet 0.24.1 it looks like the number of arguments to the function
eventlet.wsgi.HttpProtocol.__init__() from 4 to 3. This led to pylint
errors and other problems.

Change-Id: I84712c32c93541a251d87c102e2e43ce88f77a68
Closes-Bug: #1791218

commit_message:
DNM: Testing swift functional jobs

DO not MERGE.

I expect that both swiftclient-swift-dsvm-functional and
swift-dsvm-functional will do the same thing regarding required-projects
and check out - if run on python-swiftclient - both python-swiftclient
and add it to LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Let's test this assumption.

This is related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591528/7/.zuul.yaml

Change-Id: Id7cb7763a0ace3477c430b7048ba76018e548fb6

[{'created': '2018-09-07 03:06:18.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore bandit error B111 to fix gate

Bandit 1.5.1 was released earlier today [1], and the pep8 tests started
failing with references to error B111.  The error was not very easy to
see in the zuul logs [2][3] but when running locally was easy to pick
out [4].  Since test B111 is supposed to have been deleted in the latest
version of Bandit [5] we suppress the test to unbreak the gate.

[1] https://pypi.org/project/bandit/#history
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/47/583847/2/gate/openstack-tox-pep8/f5daa43/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-09-07_01_52_01_804084
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/729652/
[4] http://paste.openstack.org/show/729651/
[5] https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b111_execute_with_run_as_root_equals_true.html

Closes-Bug: #1791206

Change-Id: I52608a7f0c237e5856f21ca686ce02e08c2e3395
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore bandit error B111 to fix gate

Bandit 1.5.1 was released earlier today [1], and the pep8 tests started
failing with references to error B111.  The error was not very easy to
see in the zuul logs [2][3] but when running locally was easy to pick
out [4].  Since test B111 is supposed to have been deleted in the latest
version of Bandit [5] we suppress the test to unbreak the gate.

[1] https://pypi.org/project/bandit/#history
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/47/583847/2/gate/openstack-tox-pep8/f5daa43/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-09-07_01_52_01_804084
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/729652/
[4] http://paste.openstack.org/show/729651/
[5] https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b111_execute_with_run_as_root_equals_true.html

Closes-Bug: #1791206

Change-Id: I52608a7f0c237e5856f21ca686ce02e08c2e3395

[{'created': '2018-08-31 08:33:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix tests in stable/pike branch

This is a combination of 2 commits.
This is the 1st commit message:

Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
	neutron_lib/api/validators/__init__.py
	neutron_lib/tests/unit/api/definitions/base.py

Change-Id: I40d386b44489e6847dd9c441b3feb56e099d252e

This is the commit message #2:

Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Conflicts:
	test-requirements.txt

commit_message:
Fix tests in stable/pike branch

This is a combination of 3 commits, plus additional fixes:

releasenotes/source/conf.py required an additional pep8 fix
minimal stestr version is 2.0.0 now in stable/pike since
207650493cec84701d2bf3d7c30d5f573817a17f

This is the 1st commit message:

Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
	neutron_lib/api/validators/__init__.py
	neutron_lib/tests/unit/api/definitions/base.py

Change-Id: I40d386b44489e6847dd9c441b3feb56e099d252e

This is the commit message #2:

Fix unit test failures due to switch to testr changes

Conflicts:
	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Idae1413a769371cb7c76d4689f6dab67c72b22be

This is the commit message #3:

Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Conflicts:
	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I430dc5268fb9ef8fcd6e1009f50fb64e32089c37

commit_message:
[WIP] DO NOT MERGE

First attempt to get working services in Podman containers for TripleO.

This patch just shows how we can archive this in a convenient way, without
many changes to the current code. Of course, all services will need an update
in the same way if this solution is accepted. Please also note this patch is
focused on SELinux issues.

Change-Id: I0656d75bf59d39788bc7d41190fdeccc0e6bc416

commit_message:
Move bionic jobs to voting, add release note.

Bionic check jobs are now passing so move these to voting and
add gate/periodic jobs for bionic.

Introduce a release note detailing the major changes and indicating
a viable upgrade path from Xenial to Bionic.

Change-Id: I0897e4f22b3949ce07a2ea0f2ee9c4f45c344e04

commit_message:
Revert region name option to os_region_name for Cinder

The os_region_name option was changed to region_name for most
services inside Nova, however, it was not changed for Cinder as
that retains os_region_name.

Change-Id: I2f92d3e5cdfdfbb4a69b968d2e4d4d15389b7192

subject: Encode injected file data (client-side)
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-09-05 02:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-09-05 02:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-09-07 02:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 02:24:40.000000000', 'message': 'Encode injected file data (client-side)

In before, we sent raw file data from client to server over
HTTP. This commit encode injected file data by using
RFC 3548 that are suitable for binary data sent as
part of an HTTP request.

The file will be encoded at client side before sending it
to server. The encoded data will be decoded at server side
before injecting into the container. This commit did the
client-side encoding.

Depends-On: I1ae959778f904dc52f102721558c2ede0ca2e09e
Change-Id: I41838ccc5c0b5e01d84195cd27f1f5e4dbe84a78
'}]
commit_message:
Encode injected file data (client-side)

In before, we sent raw file data from client to server over
HTTP. This commit encode injected file data by using
RFC 3548 that are suitable for binary data sent as
part of an HTTP request.

The file will be encoded at client side before sending it
to server. The encoded data will be decoded at server side
before injecting into the container. This commit did the
client-side encoding.

Depends-On: I1ae959778f904dc52f102721558c2ede0ca2e09e
Change-Id: I41838ccc5c0b5e01d84195cd27f1f5e4dbe84a78

commit_message:
Use openstack-tox-cover template

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job as non-voting
in the check queue only.

Change-Id: I11ca9d9454d69e10e3c881ce85b6c287f57900bf

commit_message:
Add retries to delete a volume in the Nimble Driver

Retrying to delete a volume for N tries and if
failed we raise NimbleAPIException.

Change-Id: I937147b7a4caf8480a8b7429effa545cd8926a8d
Related-Bug: #1413750

commit_message:
Fix a failure to format config sample

A help string of 'enable_consoleauth' is missing
in nova/conf/workarounds.py.
So formatting sample for enable_consoleauth is failed.

This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Iad799099028f15948733451556207e7a77c1517b
Closes-Bug: #1789800
(cherry picked from commit ad1d9bd66e6a1c3538b426021962470599e480c5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 18:41:13.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia9c025776a52fd203366c794d9b85ccd0a50e3af
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia9c025776a52fd203366c794d9b85ccd0a50e3af

commit_message:
Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job as
non-voting in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Change-Id: Iabd9b962fb04dec563e7cd28543136b1062796e6

commit_message:
config-download User's Guide

Adds a full User's Guide for config-download, documenting most
everything I could think of that would be useful.

Previously the page was under the "Feature Configuration" section, and
it's now moved to it's own top level section witin the ToC.

There are a few other minor fixes and improvements included.

Change-Id: I9bc2df4f44ac4ccea565d632d0072c2c4d7b3a43

commit_message:
Allow user-defined extra distro packages

This change allows the deployer to specify lists of distro packages
which will be installed in addition to those specified by this role

Change-Id: Ief887c705ab477eeb6d56a21850ddfd85d89722b

'}, {'created': '2018-09-01 15:17:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use a common python build/install role (glance)

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

Given that the role now handles everything, and has sensible
defaults, we can remove the variables glance_venv_tag and
glance_venv_download_url in group_vars. We only need to set
venv_build_host to the first repo container which is where
we build the wheels to help speed up the venv builds.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567692
Change-Id: Ic31bd1c9f1c3eea61af50210d93aa96f9c797d92
'}, {'created': '2018-09-01 16:11:06.000000000', 'message': "Use a common python build/install role

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

Given that the role now handles everything, and has sensible
defaults, we can remove the *_venv_tag and *_venv_download_url
in group_vars.

This is by no means the final stop in the simplification
process, but it is a step forward. The will be work to follow
which:

1. Changes how we define the versions of each service we wish
   to install. Currently this requires the use of the py_pkgs
   plugin, but we'd like to eliminate that to simplify the
   mechanism to something more intuitive.
2. Changes how we set the pip install arguments for the venv
   build. Right now the repo_build consolidates all constraints
   into a single set. That code is complex, difficult to
   understand and prohibits multi-series deployments.
3. Changes how we configure pip. Given that we no longer do
   pip installs onto the host, and only use venvs, we do not
   need to place pip.conf in a global location. We can explore
   other options, including perhaps not placing pip.conf at all.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567692
Change-Id: Ic31bd1c9f1c3eea61af50210d93aa96f9c797d92
"}, {'created': '2018-09-01 16:14:37.000000000', 'message': "Use a common python build/install role

3. Changes how we configure pip. Given that we no longer do

   other options, including perhaps not placing pip.conf at all.
4. Removes the repo_build process entirely. Once the roles are
   doing everything that's required, the repo_build process will
   be redundant and can be removed.

commit_message:
Use a common python build/install role

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

Given that the role now handles everything, and has sensible
defaults, we can remove the *_venv_tag and *_venv_download_url
in group_vars.

This is by no means the final stop in the simplification
process, but it is a step forward. The will be work to follow
which:

1. Changes how we define the versions of each service we wish
   to install. Currently this requires the use of the py_pkgs
   plugin, but we'd like to eliminate that to simplify the
   mechanism to something more intuitive.
2. Changes how we set the pip install arguments for the venv
   build. Right now the repo_build consolidates all constraints
   into a single set. That code is complex, difficult to
   understand and prohibits multi-series deployments.
3. Changes how we configure pip. Given that we no longer do
   pip installs onto the host, and only use venvs, we do not
   need to place pip.conf in a global location. We can explore
   other options, including perhaps not placing pip.conf at all.
4. Removes the repo_build process entirely. Once the roles are
   doing everything that's required, the repo_build process will
   be redundant and can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/557039

commit_message:
Update build-test-package for non-centos7

In order to run this role on another OS than centos7 we need to be able
to use the package module in ansible and make the centos7 configurations
configurable. This change swaps out the centos designations for
variables so it can be configured.

Change-Id: Id7464886e9dbf18b918562bf7401a813c19d33d5

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I35793eee5f16d96d718560b27a7ad792d719af6e

"}, {'created': '2018-08-15 14:29:58.000000000', 'message': "OCP-Router - add support for OCP routes

This patch extends Kuryr's tempest plugin to verify
OCP-Route capability.

This patch includes also a generic function (named 'wait_kuryr_annotation')
for waiting (with max timeout) till specific annotation appears in object metadata.
A follow-up patch will update the current code to rely on 'wait_kuryr_annotation'
function.

Depends-On: I36e2d1e78636964bcbd86af78a24b2bb623f202a

commit_message:
OCP-Router - add support for OCP routes

This patch extends Kuryr's tempest plugin to verify
OCP-Route capability.

This patch includes also a generic function (named 'wait_kuryr_annotation')
for waiting (with max timeout) till specific annotation appears in object metadata.
A follow-up patch will update the current code to rely on 'wait_kuryr_annotation'
function.

Depends-On: Ia1816d2fa1468385544bb854af67c391050f3636
Change-Id: I8449ceb0735a9aea2e52d5d71a91a51dfd512c17

commit_message:
Should forward only first accepted packet to table 91 and 92

Regarding to performance perspective, we should only log first
accepted packet. Therefore we need to forward only first accepted
packet of each connection session to table 91 and table 92.
This is also effort to sync up with ovsfw in neutron-side [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591547/

Related-Bug: #1782576
Change-Id: Iac01088bf2c76e3f28000389596f5a1a85478d9a
(cherry picked from commit 93c71ce98af19f96282acabb58c446428bda2578)

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Initiator retrieval short hostname fix

This submission fixes a timeout issue with initiator retrieval, the fix
uses targeted extraction instead of list matching to increase
performance. Short hostname retrieval for hostnames with 16 or characters
has been fixed.

Change-Id: I4eff572448c720746fbdd49caf3ae2dccfb3d352
Closes-Bug: #1783855
Closes-Bug: #1783867

commit_message:
Rebase patch in reproducing as zuul does in CI

When we clone patches in CI with Zuul, it rebases them to latest
branch, so that we have always the latest code.
Reproducer should reproduce job exactly as it's in Ci, so let's
rebase patch when we clone it. It also ensures that we'll install
it because it'll have higher version that installed one and we'll
check the patch, not just latest master.

Change-Id: I3ee9382ccb85b5af06f1b0e1ddba1dc496cf04f4

the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

commit_message:
Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job as
non-voting in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Change-Id: Ib9127fb4bb0edcfc9a377b177d44f995ef406cec

commit_message:
Should forward only first accepted packet to table 91 and 92

Regarding to performance perspective, we should only log first
accepted packet. Therefore we need to forward only first accepted
packet of each connection session to table 91 and table 92.
This is also effort to sync up with ovsfw in neutron-side [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591547/

Related-Bug: #1782576
Change-Id: Iac01088bf2c76e3f28000389596f5a1a85478d9a
(cherry picked from commit 93c71ce98af19f96282acabb58c446428bda2578)

commit_message:
Correctly set registry_pkg_manager

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597153/
registry_pkg_manager was set to dnf for Centos7 as
well due to wrong string comparison, This patch convert
ansible_distribution_major_version to integer before
comparison and fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I603c1f932c63d07040e6aa24f1a75eab4e389738
Related-Blueprint: dnf-support

commit_message:

during the Queens cycle [1],[2].

- glance_api_version
- nova_catalog_info
- os_privileged_user_name
- os_privileged_user_password
- os_privileged_user_tenant
- os_privileged_user_auth_url

[1] https://review.openstack.org/502190
[2] https://review.openstack.org/503596

Closes-Bug: #1790217
Change-Id: I973563145dacc7bd2b1ee43daff9c84d30bf2732

recheck Problem: nothing provides python-django_compressor >= 2.0 needed by python-horizon-plugin-sahara-ui-9.0.0.0~xbeta4~dev1-1.1.noarch'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-06 20:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 12:33:09.000000000', 'message': "Ensure dashboard plugins are found by py_pkgs

The py_pkgs plugin cannot interpret jinja, so it ignores
the current set of optional packages. This results in the
repo_build process ignoring them all, ultimately resulting
in the heat role failing because it cannot find the wheel
it needs in what the repo build has produced - nor can it
go out to get it from pypi because it's restricted by
pip.conf from doing so.

For now, until we are able to eliminate pip.conf or change
the build process to allow the role wheel builds to go out
to pypi, we ensure that py_pkgs will pick up and build
these packages by implementing them into individual
*_optional_pip_packages lists. This matches the mechanism
used in the os_neutron role.

Change-Id: Ia92eb5b1355ceceada323bd075b08729afd6280f
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure dashboard plugins are found by py_pkgs

The py_pkgs plugin cannot interpret jinja, so it ignores
the current set of optional packages. This results in the
repo_build process ignoring them all, ultimately resulting
in the heat role failing because it cannot find the wheel
it needs in what the repo build has produced - nor can it
go out to get it from pypi because it's restricted by
pip.conf from doing so.

For now, until we are able to eliminate pip.conf or change
the build process to allow the role wheel builds to go out
to pypi, we ensure that py_pkgs will pick up and build
these packages by implementing them into individual
*_optional_pip_packages lists. This matches the mechanism
used in the os_neutron role.

Change-Id: Ia92eb5b1355ceceada323bd075b08729afd6280f

Add params for network_config_hook

net-config-multinode-os-net-config.yaml uses
/etc/nodepool/* files which will be removed
with zuulv3 native jobs.

This review adds ansible inventory variables to
replace /etc/nodepool/* code.

Change-Id: I73142a77aa782b44d07e347f7ffb23a9580a3d25

commit_message:
WIP - Remove usage of /etc/nodepool

/etc/nodepool/* reples on legacy code.
As part of the move to zuulv3 native, we are removing
all references to /etc/nodepool/* and replacing them
with ansible inventory variables.

Depends-On: I73142a77aa782b44d07e347f7ffb23a9580a3d25
Change-Id: Ib4d1d5e80541db374069f6b65d5b244e614aa17d

[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-04 12:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-09-04 12:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-05 06:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-05 06:32:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm fine with this approach (of adding a new puppet-nova param), am just a bit concerned about how we are going to backport this without breaking anyone. Maybe it is simpler to just user the nova_config approach (i.e. without a new puppet-nova parameter) and backport everything to rocky and *then* we add a parameter to puppet-nova in master. Seems that would be a bit simpler?"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
use the new puppet-nova parameter for sync_power_state_interval

Use the new sync_power_state_interval parameter from puppet-nova to
avoid any breakage in the future, like Puppet resource duplication
error.

commit_message:
Timeout support for api and engine

Added timeout support for qinling api and qinling engine so that it can
accept and query the server with timeout parameter.

Change-Id: Ic5aad2e85ecf888fdfa85691fe785dd48f5490fd
Task: 20039
Story: 2002174

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Story: #2002586
Task: #24325

subject: Revert "Change log hashing to SHA256"
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 22:04:59.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Change log hashing to SHA256"

We should exempt previous releases from this check. We
should not change the behavior in a backport.

This also adds nosec comment since this usage of sha1 is
confined to log hashing.

This reverts commit 52822f1c11fc7dc1a3fe5001691f2f05eeac20d9.

Change-Id: I8b2a479ee929f85d19fbea76ff082b725fc50e81
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Change log hashing to SHA256"

We should exempt previous releases from this check. We
should not change the behavior in a backport.

This also adds nosec comment since this usage of sha1 is
confined to log hashing.

This reverts commit 52822f1c11fc7dc1a3fe5001691f2f05eeac20d9.

Change-Id: I8b2a479ee929f85d19fbea76ff082b725fc50e81

messages: [{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-08-13 20:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 20866, 'date': '2018-08-14 07:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-15 15:40:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-06 14:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 20:02:10.000000000', 'message': 'Correct Cinder NetApp backend name parameter mapping

Change to pass CinderNetappBackendName to the correct
parameter in the Cinder puppet module:

  cinder::backend::netapp::volume_backend_name

This allows backend name overrides to be reflected in
the deployed overcloud.

Change-Id: I851f0a5bdcd82d6bcca78da1f530a1e0b77a757c
Closes-Bug: 1779500
(cherry picked from commit 7d85acf2a81365ce0a8e06f88ecb18bae8ea785f)
(cherry picked from commit 4e25ce087ef7e75328a48294b4132c0a6a6d38ac)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct Cinder NetApp backend name parameter mapping

Change to pass CinderNetappBackendName to the correct
parameter in the Cinder puppet module:

  cinder::backend::netapp::volume_backend_name

This allows backend name overrides to be reflected in
the deployed overcloud.

Change-Id: I851f0a5bdcd82d6bcca78da1f530a1e0b77a757c
Closes-Bug: 1779500
(cherry picked from commit 7d85acf2a81365ce0a8e06f88ecb18bae8ea785f)
(cherry picked from commit 4e25ce087ef7e75328a48294b4132c0a6a6d38ac)

commit_message:
Fix interfaces in boot_param_tasks

Ansible stores all interfaces with _ in facts. It's very easy to check by
running 'ansible -i inv all -m setup'. This patch adds replace - with _ to find
interface properly in facts.

Closes-Bug: #1786212
Resolves: rhbz#1614036

Change-Id: Id290143d8a41964806ca9c5be4d7103a3833cb37
(cherry picked from commit 6ab5112eb207cd2f87956f1c574d0b70236ef2e3)

commit_message:
Fix TripleO guide and ovn.yaml file

Replace the link at step 1 from the TripleO deployment guide with the
actual instructions.

That link was broken didn't contain any deployment steps cause it was
moved to another place at [0]. Since we only needed two steps from that
guide (1. To download the quickstart.sh script and 2. To install the
depedencies) I think we could safely add this steps to our own guide.

For the ovn.yaml we are expliciting adding the configuration option
listing the NTP servers that the undercloud should use as part of it's
deployment.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/dcd32355f4e0debd38608de0b47c17550dacd5d2

Change-Id: Ia96e2acc7ae3b93f9224e19345ef459c2898d45d

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ib58745d5c0d98fb79eb3cf7278c2cbfb5160efcd

commit_message:
Fix placement_client max microversion

Placement introduced the json body response for resource provider
creation from microversion 1.20.
As the client introduced in neutron_lib uses the returned body (see:
https://review.openstack.org/589749) the used maximum microversion must
be bumped as well.

Change-Id: I71a723a95fb407a97aa6793beb965ae7be1769a7

commit_message:
Fix tests to honor Octavia API versioning

This patch adds support for Octavia API endpoint versioning.
Previously Rocky API additions were being tested, regardless of the Octavia
API version.
It also fixes a potential race condition when testing the "ONLINE"
operating status.
The patch also makes sure that duplicate fixed IP addresses are not allocated
on subnets.

Story: 2003466
Task: 24726

Change-Id: If0ec777f34326c09c7215d9c7c2ed249571d779e

AMD procs not supported?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-06 16:50:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Matthew AMD procs will be ignored. We don't use them, but if anyone who does wants to patch in the appropriate and equivalent procedure, they may go ahead."}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-09-06 17:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-09-06 17:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

You may want the "nested=y" option, but that may be the default.

Reference: https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/guides/devstack-with-nested-kvm.html'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-06 17:26:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yep, that's enabled by default on xenial/bionic at least by the package install:

  root@mnaio-bionic1:~# cat /etc/modprobe.d/qemu-system-x86.conf
  options kvm_intel nested=1"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-06 17:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ah, I see you meant for AMD CPU's. Sure, although for our use-case this isn't necessary as we're not using AMD CPU's with this tooling. It'd be a fairly straightforward patch for anyone who's interested."}]

commit_message:
MNAIO: Ensure that nested virt is enabled on host

Nested virtualization is important to improve VM performance
and enabling it is crucial to ensuring that VM images built
on one host work on boot on other hosts because the environment
is consistent.

In this patch add a task to enable it if it is available.

Change-Id: I812d8399cf45fab94f0f46976c9415591d45e463

commit_message:
Enable recursion when requested by forwarders or users

Forwarders do not work unless recursion is enabled. Also, allow users to
set recursion explicitly when they want BIND9 set up by the charm to act
as a full-service resolver.

Documentation has been updated to warn users to set ACLs when enabling
forwarders or recursion to avoid it from being a open resolver.

Change-Id: I53d53decbbae12e0b743aa34421d63a5a5c892f1
Closes-Bug: #1776952
Co-Authored-By: Pedro <pedro.guimaraes@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4132f05db4b7bc3a64980a6adb10028c36604203)

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh

This patch removes a legacy tool for installing tox which started
breaking stable branches based on openstack-requirements. This is a
handcrafted version of the following patch:

  If162dde93423a495064c4ae1a5dad4e7eb8f9577

This wasn't a direct cherry-pick due to the conflicts with refactoring
to use doc/requirements.txt. This change also includes support for
switching keystoneauth to use stestr. This is because requirements for
stable/pike include os-testr 1.0.0 which uses stestr under the
covers.

Change-Id: I077325d9b8ea8b99a8b5a8ae3de6aef20c7e4f43

commit_message:
docker-puppet: don't force FACTER_hostname

We don't need that anymore, the $::hostname fact is already
computed by facter when running in the container. We need the value to
be the consistent so puppet variables work correctly.

Change-Id: If29a3b2d503fc287beabb548962552c66d8f473c

commit_message:
Move mistral-extra under mistral repos

This was released as its own thing in Newton, but since then has always
been included as the set of mistral releases. This updates the repo list
for the Mistral team to group it with the other main deliverables so it
matches what is actually being delivered. It also gets rid of a warning
in the release repo validation jobs that identify this mismatch.

Change-Id: I0103fa10e6f9c4d05c70fb914d2a123412f94ac0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
A script to check the failure domains of OSDs in PGs

The checkPGs script is implemented to check the Object Storage
Daemons (OSDs) in Placement Groups (PGs) of ceph pools to make
sure OSDs were not allocated from the same failure domain.  This
script is intended to run from any one of the ceph-mon pods.

Invoke the checkPGs script with --help to get the details on how
to run it.

A Kubernetes cron job is created to schedule the execution of
this script at a regular interval.  The execution frequency is
defined in the ceph-mon/values.yaml file.

Change-Id: I5d46bc824e88545cde1cc448ae714d7d3c243817

They fail, because of the commit in eventlet [1]. oslo_service should find a way in its tests [2] to open socket, which will not be in IDLE state.

2.

if there's at least one (IPv4 or IPv6) entry in the hosts file.

commit_message:
Bump eventlet to 0.24.1

We want this patch [0] in eventlet that avoids contacting nameservers
if there's at least one (IPv4 or IPv6) entry in the hosts file.
In the case where no nameservers are configured, this will avoid
unnecessary delays when resolving hostnames.

[0] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/10ff67f84a1e2f53c8eb254944ebf81762041b45

Change-Id: Ia18372625d1e5c87a3afdb5617f0390c19d46470
Closes-bug: #1785615

commit_message:
Update Openshift upper constraints

Openshift 0.6.2/0.6.3 don't work with kubernetes 7.0.0
(due to [1] bug).

This bug was resolved in Openshift 0.7.0

[1] - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/44328

Change-Id: Ia1816d2fa1468385544bb854af67c391050f3636

"}, {'created': '2018-09-05 03:51:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove networking-odl from global-requirements

This is a terrible idea!

Since networking-odl 13.0.0 hit pypi which includes I955c9d737864b8a2557366be518922e192f4be91
the integration gate fails because ceilometer isn't on pypi[1].  There
aren't any good fixes but this *should* at least unblock the,
requirements, gate and buy us time to fix it correctly.

Note:
 * We can't just install ceilometer from git as we'll just fail when we
   try to generate a constraints list anyway.
 * We can't blacklist networking-odl as the backlist isn't used for
   generating a freeze only for filtering the output constraints
 * We can't stop building the constratints as that introduces a new
   failure path in the gate.

So with those options ruled out lets just pretend that networking-odl
isn't in global-requirements.  This will still fail if something
(directly or not) installs it from pypi.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/96/594496/2/check/requirements-integration/8378cd8/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-08-31_22_54_49_357505

Change-Id: I1f117f9f4d8f49b5c4ef0cb74d98560c9a551999

commit_message:
Remove networking-odl from g-r in the requirements-integration job

This is a terrible idea!

Since networking-odl 13.0.0 hit pypi which includes I955c9d737864b8a2557366be518922e192f4be91
the integration gate fails because ceilometer isn't on pypi[1].  There
aren't any good fixes but this *should* at least unblock the,
requirements, gate and buy us time to fix it correctly.

Note:
 * We can't just install ceilometer from git as we'll just fail when we
   try to generate a constraints list anyway.
 * We can't blacklist networking-odl as the backlist isn't used for
   generating a freeze only for filtering the output constraints
 * We can't stop building the constratints as that introduces a new
   failure path in the gate.

So with those options ruled out lets just pretend that networking-odl
isn't in global-requirements.  This will still fail if something
(directly or not) installs it from pypi.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/96/594496/2/check/requirements-integration/8378cd8/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-08-31_22_54_49_357505

Change-Id: I1f117f9f4d8f49b5c4ef0cb74d98560c9a551999

commit_message:
Allow for backwards compatibility with swift3.

While s3api is the preferred method going forward, it would be nice to
allow for backwards compatibility with swift3 in the tempauth
middleware.

Change-Id: I4fd4772b1d7b173ee0faf72d1c1f1531646dde8b

subject: Move coverage jobs to non-voting gate jobs
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-06 18:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-06 18:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nwrong chnage'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 18:10:05.000000000', 'message': 'Move coverage jobs to non-voting gate jobs

There was a thread some time ago that suggested coverage jobs weren't
doing much in the "post" pipeline because nobody looks at them and the
change numbers may be difficult to find anyway [1].  This came up
again in a cleanup to add non-voting coverage jobs in
I5c42530d1dda41b8dc8c13cdb10458745bec7bcc

There really is no consistency across projects; it seems like a couple
of different approaches have been cargo-cult copied as new projects
came in, depending on which random project was used as a template.

This change does a cleanup by moving all post coverage jobs into the
check queue as non-voting jobs using the template "openstack-cover-jobs".

Note that only repos are updated that are not currently in the process
of the python3-first migration, these repos need separate handling
in-repo.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099491.html

Change-Id: If7c93d7fa147ed512ecf403fb153eb5c93a848b3
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <jaegerandi@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Wienand <iwienand@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move coverage jobs to non-voting gate jobs

There was a thread some time ago that suggested coverage jobs weren't
doing much in the "post" pipeline because nobody looks at them and the
change numbers may be difficult to find anyway [1].  This came up
again in a cleanup to add non-voting coverage jobs in
I5c42530d1dda41b8dc8c13cdb10458745bec7bcc

There really is no consistency across projects; it seems like a couple
of different approaches have been cargo-cult copied as new projects
came in, depending on which random project was used as a template.

This change does a cleanup by moving all post coverage jobs into the
check queue as non-voting jobs using the template "openstack-cover-jobs".

Note that only repos are updated that are not currently in the process
of the python3-first migration, these repos need separate handling
in-repo.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099491.html

Change-Id: If7c93d7fa147ed512ecf403fb153eb5c93a848b3
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <jaegerandi@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Wienand <iwienand@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add OpenFlow listen address to standalone configuration

In standalone configuration, the local controller needs to specify
on which address it is listening.

One scenario is in case the local controller is containerised.
Dragonflow informs OVS where the controller is listening, and
then OVS knows where to connect to the controller.

Related-Bug: #1778007
Change-Id: I4b4cdae3aa848aa02a8148a9d47f6262f707e0ce

commit_message:
Passwords mismatches when using custom plan env

Passwords are differed when using custom plan environment with
-p or --plan-environment-file option during plan update.
Passwords are loaded from environment file when updating plan
with custom plan environment file.
Need to update the logic to invoke load passwords when using
custom plan environment file also.

Change-Id: Ic206351ced77088f70e9e1fc25270b2c097b349b
Closes-Bug: #1790580
(cherry picked from commit 764a5a65b08bd1f9c22e25866025c191725c11ac)

commit_message:
Add Barbican scenarios

Added code to get a python-barbican client object,
Barbican-secret test cases. Added clean up functions.
Added unit tests for all new scenarios.

This is based off the work of Sonali Pitre, it has been
updated with the rally-openstack git repository, this
includes:

- Fixing the module imports
- Fixing the scenarios for missing fields, namely
  the SLA entries.
- Updating the unit tests.

Change-Id: I550449ab459ed04a49d04524da08b730ec114546
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 12:07:51.000000000', 'message': "MNAIO: Ensure that virt-networks are properly setup

Due to the rather terrible virt_net module, only one action
can be done on the virt networks at any one time. This means
that the current action of setting them to autostart has no
effect, because the module does not do it. As such, after a
host reboot, the networks are not started and the VM's cannot
start. When trying to resolve this by re-running the host
setup, the play ignores any existing virt networks - so the
issue cannot be fixed.

This patch does the following:

1. Changes the define/create action into a single action which
   will not change the network configuration if it is defined.
2. Implements the setting of the network as active, and the
   setting of it to autostart as two seperate tasks. This
   ensures that both actions are actually implemented.

Change-Id: I608f2607824fac649f4e018d89094d57047134b3
"}, {'created': '2018-09-06 12:11:05.000000000', 'message': "MNAIO: Ensure that virt-networks are properly setup

Due to the rather terrible virt_net module, only one action
can be done on the virt networks at any one time. This means
that the current action of setting them to autostart has no
effect, because the module does not do it. Also, the current
action of disabling the default network and disabling it from
autostarting also does not take full effect. As such, after a
host reboot, the default network autostarts, and the other
networks are not started and the VM's cannot start. When trying
to resolve this by re-running the host setup, the play ignores
any existing virt networks - so the issue cannot be fixed.

This patch does the following:

1. Ensures that the default network does not autostart. This
   is done by splitting the disabling of the network, and the
   disabling of autostart into two tasks.
2. Changes the define/create action into a single action which
   will not change the network configuration if it is defined.
3. Implements the setting of the network as active, and the
   setting of it to autostart as two seperate tasks. This
   ensures that both actions are actually implemented.

Change-Id: I608f2607824fac649f4e018d89094d57047134b3
"}]
commit_message:
MNAIO: Ensure that virt-networks are properly setup

Due to the rather terrible virt_net module, only one action
can be done on the virt networks at any one time. This means
that the current action of setting them to autostart has no
effect, because the module does not do it. Also, the current
action of disabling the default network and disabling it from
autostarting also does not take full effect. As such, after a
host reboot, the default network autostarts, and the other
networks are not started and the VM's cannot start. When trying
to resolve this by re-running the host setup, the play ignores
any existing virt networks - so the issue cannot be fixed.

This patch does the following:

1. Ensures that the default network does not autostart. This
   is done by splitting the disabling of the network, and the
   disabling of autostart into two tasks.
2. Changes the define/create action into a single action which
   will not change the network configuration if it is defined.
3. Implements the setting of the network as active, and the
   setting of it to autostart as two seperate tasks. This
   ensures that both actions are actually implemented.

Change-Id: I608f2607824fac649f4e018d89094d57047134b3

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I482073ef15154dff754839ffd161fe08211ebc89
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

Implements: ceph/rbd utility script

This is an effort to implement ceph and rbd utility.
This utilities can be used to perform ceph/rbd operations without
having to drop into container shell using kubectl exec

Signed-off-by: Sreejith Punnapuzha <Sreejith.Punnapuzha@outlook.com>

[{'created': '2018-08-20 08:16:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lost connection when create security group log

Packet sent to table 91 are considered accepted by the egress pipeline
and NORMAL action is used by default in this table. However, if we
create a security group logging resource, then ovs flows log will be
added into this table with higher priority. Therefore packet matches
with ovs flows log will be sent to CONTROLLER and never forward.
So this patch append action=NORMAL into ovs flows log to forward
the packet and send it to CONTROLLER for logging.

Closes-Bug: #1787106
Change-Id: I6e95e2e646ec8a5507c7f140ab2c4a56be8404c3
(cherry picked from commit 7d2ac2d0aff90d17d2e46aba2af3b4cc32d1833c)

commit_message:
Fix lost connection when create security group log

Packet sent to table 91 are considered accepted by the egress pipeline
and NORMAL action is used by default in this table. However, if we
create a security group logging resource, then ovs flows log will be
added into this table with higher priority. Therefore packet matches
with ovs flows log will be sent to CONTROLLER and never forward.
So this patch append action=NORMAL into ovs flows log to forward
the packet and send it to CONTROLLER for logging.

Closes-Bug: #1787106
Change-Id: I6e95e2e646ec8a5507c7f140ab2c4a56be8404c3
(cherry picked from commit 7d2ac2d0aff90d17d2e46aba2af3b4cc32d1833c)

commit_message:
Fix the scenario parent job to use the live base

The dsvm scenario jobs was using "octavia-dsvm-base" parent job and
not the required "octavia-dsvm-live-base" job. This patch corrects that.

It also changes the "octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-centos.7" job name to
"octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-centos-7" to comply with the naming guideline[1].

The same change is applied to the bionic job, which becomes "-bionic".

It also increases the job timeout for "live" jobs to 9,000 seconds, or
2.5 hours to accomidate tcg gate hosts.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/ \
    drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: I7aaa86bf0a626cbef17611445d4499969741534d

commit_message:
remove job settings for senlin repositories

have been migrated to the git repositories owned by the senlin team.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Story: #2002586
Task: #24334

messages:
[{'account_id': 28704, 'date': '2018-07-19 13:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-19 13:29:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28704, 'date': '2018-07-19 18:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24165, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Al, great job on first PS :) Just one suggestions and a question
1) First line in comment (git commit) section should be short and should fit in 1 line. 
2) In description, you are saying that "script is intended to run on a ceph-mon" but you are mounting script to moncheck deployment. commit_message:
A script to check the failure domains of OSDs in PGs

The checkPGs script is implemented to check the Object Storage
Daemons (OSDs) in Placement Groups (PGs) of ceph pools to make
sure OSDs were not allocated from the same failure domain.  This
script is intended to run from any one of the ceph-mon pods.

Invoke the checkPGs script with --help to get the details on how
to run it.

A Kubernetes cron job is created to schedule the execution of
this script at a regular interval.  The execution frequency is
defined in the ceph-mon/values.yaml file.

Change-Id: I29e5bee87c8ef9ae823ed665175be91f4df70bce

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-20476 : FAILURE in 57m 28s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-21 17:18:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

Okay, I figured it out.

There is (already, before this patch) a race between the API and compute services.  The API service is removing the host from the aggregate while the compute service is deleting the instance.

Both things are trying to set the compute node's aggregates to [], but whichever one gets there first is bumping the generation on the server, so when the second one submits the (same) request, it bounces 409.  And that's why we weren't seeing it before this patch - because we were just replacing the aggregates without regard for generation conflicts.

Solving the race itself is going to be outside the scope of this patch.  What we need here is a check (like we seem to have for all the other, similar methods, not sure how we missed it on this one) to short-circuit if the aggregates we're setting match what's already in the cache."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-21 17:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-21 17:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-22 00:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

This legitimately failed three times in a row, and the messages [1] show that the generation really was climbing each time. I still haven't looked into exactly what was going on with the provider to make that happen (probably need to scrutinize the placement logs). While it's encouraging that the various rechecks since then haven't reproduced the error, it also concerns me that none of them have shown even one retry. IOW I have no indication that the conflict scenario is actually resolvable with the retry.

Going to keep trying to reproduce until I get a chance to dig into the logs some more.

Okay, I checked five jobs (tempest-full[-py3], nova-cells-v1, nova-multiattach, nova-next) in each of the 13 runs since PS12, inclusive, and found a total of 13 instances of the retry code being hit.  (The 13/13 thing is just a coincidence; it wasn't one per run or anything.)  It was *always* hit in n-api, never in n-cpu.  It never hit the nova-cells-v1 job (not sure if that's because that job doesn't hit the code path, or again just coincidence).

 PS | run | job              | retries | log
 ===+=====+==================+=========+==================================================================================================================================

 > per run or anything.)  It was *always* hit in n-api, never in
 > n-cpu.

This makes sense because we hold a compute node semaphore when making changes to inventory for the resource provider on the compute host. No such semaphore is held on the nova-api worker."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-10 16:22:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> This makes sense because we hold a compute node semaphore when making changes to inventory for the resource provider on the compute host. No such semaphore is held on the nova-api worker.

Maybe I still don't understand the interaction, but I was expecting the n-cpu and n-api sides to conflict with *each other*, which ought to mean the retry could hit on either side."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:33:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> I'll bump the retry limit to 4

I didn't do this. Anyone think I should?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:38:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> It never hit the nova-cells-v1 job (not sure if that's because that job doesn't hit the code path, or again just coincidence).

cells v1 doesn't support host aggregates so that's why it's not present in that job"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-10 19:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2018-07-03 19:51:30.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Tighten up ReportClient use of generation

Update aggregate-related scheduler report client methods to use
placement microversion 1.19, which returns provider generation in GET
/rps/{u}/aggregates and handles generation conflicts in PUT
/rps/{u}/aggregates. Helper methods previously returning aggregates and
traits now also return the generation, which is fed through
appropriately to subsequent calls. As a result, the generation kwarg is
no longer needed in _refresh_associations, so it is removed.

Doing this exposes race described in the cited bug, so we add a
@retry_on_exception decorator to the resource tracker's _update and the
report client's aggregate_{add|remove}_host methods.

Related to blueprint placement-aggregate-generation
Closes-Bug: #1779931

WIP: Test coverage for @retry_on_exception and its usages

commit_message:
Check provider generation and retry on conflict

Update aggregate-related scheduler report client methods to use
placement microversion 1.19, which returns provider generation in GET
/rps/{u}/aggregates and handles generation conflicts in PUT
/rps/{u}/aggregates. Helper methods previously returning aggregates and
traits now also return the generation, which is fed through
appropriately to subsequent calls. As a result, the generation kwarg is
no longer needed in _refresh_associations, so it is removed.

Doing this exposes the race described in the cited bug, so we add a
retry decorator to the resource tracker's _update and the report
client's aggregate_{add|remove}_host methods.

Related to blueprint placement-aggregate-generation
Closes-Bug: #1779931

Change-Id: I3c5fbb18297db71e682fcddb5bf4536595d92383

[{'created': '2018-09-06 07:58:52.000000000', 'message': "Drop subnet Port Groups

This patch is dropping the code that creates and handles the
subnet Port Groups. Those were used to place the ACLs that
allowed DHCP traffic to reach the responder in the OVN
pipeline but as explained in the bug description, it's
not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I30bee5c5576554b162e66e1b5dfbe734522ab363
Closes-Bug: #1790900
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Drop subnet Port Groups

This patch is dropping the code that creates and handles the
subnet Port Groups. Those were used to place the ACLs that
allowed DHCP traffic to reach the responder in the OVN
pipeline but as explained in the bug description, it's
not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I30bee5c5576554b162e66e1b5dfbe734522ab363
Closes-Bug: #1790900
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

subject: Make sure the branch to track is in YAML
messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-09-04 13:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-06 13:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 13:29:22.000000000', 'message': "Make sure the branch to track is in YAML

There is no reason to rely on comments in the files
used to bump the SHAs of upstream repositories.

Without this, a contributor can easily add a comment
and break the tooling, which relies on regexps and
well formated files to behave.

Instead, as this is a YAML file, we should rely on
a YAML parser in the release tooling, for more
robustness.

This fixes the issues by adding an extra key
(_git_track_branch) per repository, showing what to track.
This could be used in release tooling, and is not hurting
the existing code, as the extra keys are not loaded:
Those files are only consumed by the py_pkgs lookup, which
won't read this extra key.

Change-Id: I8fe08f389160e7be17dd56afde22173778540855
(manual cherry picked from commit 2a288e1b1e57d2986b25851b51613452c891f3e0)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure the branch to track is in YAML

There is no reason to rely on comments in the files
used to bump the SHAs of upstream repositories.

Without this, a contributor can easily add a comment
and break the tooling, which relies on regexps and
well formated files to behave.

Instead, as this is a YAML file, we should rely on
a YAML parser in the release tooling, for more
robustness.

This fixes the issues by adding an extra key
(_git_track_branch) per repository, showing what to track.
This could be used in release tooling, and is not hurting
the existing code, as the extra keys are not loaded:
Those files are only consumed by the py_pkgs lookup, which
won't read this extra key.

Change-Id: I8fe08f389160e7be17dd56afde22173778540855
(manual cherry picked from commit 2a288e1b1e57d2986b25851b51613452c891f3e0)
