commit_message:
Move metadata file creation of glance netapp to puppet-tripelo from THT

Since, openstack-glance package has been removed from overcloud image
during the cleanup, 'filesystem_store_metadata_file' file is failing to
create on host in case of glance netapp.

So, adding metadata file creation part in puppet-tripleo.

Change-Id: I031a8921a74af137927ba83ee2307aafc13263cb

subject: WIP Ceph Operations Guide
messages:
[{'account_id': 28967, 'date': '2018-08-27 23:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-08-27 23:58:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28967, 'date': '2018-09-06 15:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-09-04 13:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-06 13:41:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 13:41:48.000000000', 'message': "Make sure the branch to track is in YAML

There is no reason to rely on comments in the files
used to bump the SHAs of upstream repositories.

Without this, a contributor can easily add a comment
and break the tooling, which relies on regexps and
well formated files to behave.

Instead, as this is a YAML file, we should rely on
a YAML parser in the release tooling, for more
robustness.

This fixes the issues by adding an extra key
(_git_track_branch) per repository, showing what to track.
This could be used in release tooling, and is not hurting
the existing code, as the extra keys are not loaded:
Those files are only consumed by the py_pkgs lookup, which
won't read this extra key.

Change-Id: I8fe08f389160e7be17dd56afde22173778540855
(manual cherry picked from commit 2a288e1b1e57d2986b25851b51613452c891f3e0)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure the branch to track is in YAML

There is no reason to rely on comments in the files
used to bump the SHAs of upstream repositories.

Without this, a contributor can easily add a comment
and break the tooling, which relies on regexps and
well formated files to behave.

Instead, as this is a YAML file, we should rely on
a YAML parser in the release tooling, for more
robustness.

This fixes the issues by adding an extra key
(_git_track_branch) per repository, showing what to track.
This could be used in release tooling, and is not hurting
the existing code, as the extra keys are not loaded:
Those files are only consumed by the py_pkgs lookup, which
won't read this extra key.

Change-Id: I8fe08f389160e7be17dd56afde22173778540855
(manual cherry picked from commit 2a288e1b1e57d2986b25851b51613452c891f3e0)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: If9bf19198fd8c9165f98e359b21c78a5857c5750
Story: #2002586
Task: #24340

commit_message:
Fix Invalid filter: parse_isotime

Watcher-dashboard is using parse_isotime filter
in templates, which causes templates to be invalid.
Issue can be fixed by importing filters from horizon.utils,
where filter is already defined.

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.1/howto/custom-template-tags/

Change-Id: I6b89ca48efe1cd7d4d98025ee45d733a86b5dc2f
Closes-bug: #1791038

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-03 12:28:14.000000000', 'message': 'Support bare metal service error messages

The bare metal service returns errors in a non-standard format. To make it
worse, it also JSON-encodes errors twice due to weird interaction between
WSME and Pecan. This patch implements both the double-encoded and the future
correct format.

Change-Id: Icfdd223e3a2b6f7b390be8d6581007be8b14666f
'}]
commit_message:
Support bare metal service error messages

The bare metal service returns errors in a non-standard format. To make it
worse, it also JSON-encodes errors twice due to weird interaction between
WSME and Pecan. This patch implements both the double-encoded and the future
correct format.

Change-Id: Icfdd223e3a2b6f7b390be8d6581007be8b14666f

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ic06696bedb94f7bed1af01617c242594dccf27f6
Story: #2002586
Task: #24305

config download. This patch updates it in the similar
way as [1].

commit_message:
Don't use keystone admin endpoint for nova placement

We're trying to move away from using keystone's admin endpoint. This
uses the internal one instead.

Change-Id: I9aabf0ac8f1fb21f835937fa4354cad3c8443211

Previously Ansible ANSI coloring was enabled only when an interactive
terminal was detected. While this works well for command line usage
it does never work on CI because we lack an interactive TTY on it.

Forcing ANSI to be enabled all the time is also bad because it may
break console output redirection if user does not have an ANSI

This change would enable ANSI coloring only if we detect presence
of BUILD_URL variable which indicates a Jenkins build. We do not
look for JENKINS_URL variable because there is a small chance that
user may define this variable in his config, just to point to a
Jenkins server.

Also this change makes the code more flexible as it will never
override an already defined ANSIBLE_FORCE_COLOR variable, allowing
users to tune execution behaviour without having to touch quickstart.sh

commit_message:
Enable Ansible ANSI colored output on CI builds

Previously Ansible ANSI coloring was enabled only when an interactive
terminal was detected. While this works well for command line usage
it does never work on CI because we lack an interactive TTY on it.

Forcing ANSI to be enabled all the time is also bad because it may
break console output redirection if user does not have an ANSI
filter.

This change would enable ANSI coloring only if we detect presence
of BUILD_URL variable which indicates a Jenkins build. We do not
look for JENKINS_URL variable because there is a small chance that
user may define this variable in his config, just to point to a
Jenkins server.

Also this change makes the code more flexible as it will never
override an already defined ANSIBLE_FORCE_COLOR variable, allowing
users to tune execution behaviour without having to touch quickstart.sh
source code.

Related-Bug: #1787912
Change-Id: I2e4b8f2c63f957abcb489e4623ddf7c2afbf3af7

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/594318/
Change-Id: Ic63bd16dcc1eff98ee9c7926d11f1fa5d07e9259
Story: #2002586
Task: #24324

commit_message:
Cast ansible_distribution_major_version as integer.

The ansible_distribution_major_version variable
is checked to decide if using yum or dnf to perform
the docker package update but it needs to be treated
as an integer, otherwise the > operation doesn't work
as expected.

Change-Id: I72f4bfddd4cd0e63bca2444f1c0c60be771c9f19
Closes-Bug: #1791082

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

Remove also tools/tox_install.sh usage, it breaks doc building and is
not needed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I1f33955c761091bcbc4227dcfcc2f9bd7fbe9357
Story: #2002586
Task: #24295

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Run with KVM if we can in tests""

Instances are failing to launch on OVH in Tempest runs with the following:
KVM: entry failed, hardware error 0x0

Octavia team reporting the same.

This reverts commit 7961d67274b038aeec701cb30c99196301b55c5e.

Change-Id: I642982ac0363c3a1abec7de59aeccb36056896ac

commit_message:
Fix functional tests gate

With commit 88f5e11d8bf[1], neutron plugs new ports as dead vlan. During
functional tests all the ports are untagged. So such tag should be
removed during functional testing.

Closes-Bug: #1777673

[1] I024bbbdf7059835b2f23c264b48478c71633a43c

Change-Id: I7b472b4a4f51fea473635fbd731a897e46af5eee
(cherry picked from commit a46f7d601568a56437a0cc84c32917da9dc591bc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 01:12:35.000000000', 'message': "Make libreswan driver work with recent versions

LibreSwan 3.19 introduces a new commandline argument '--nssdir' for
pluto which defaults to '/etc/ipsec.d'. As older versions don't
understand such an option, we cannot just add it to the commandline.

The commandline arguments of LibreSwan are not stable enough to rely on.
For example, in 3.19, 'ipsec initnss' has the new argument '--nssdir',
and in 3.20, 'ipsec pluto' also gets this new argument '--nssdir', then
in 3.22, the argument '--ctlbase' is phased out.

In this commit, instead of trying new options and then fallback to old
ones for older versions, the bind-mount method used in StrongSwan driver
is adopted. With /etc and /var/run bind mounted, all the commandline
arguments related to configuration file places can be removed. This
ensures that changes of such arguments between different versions won't
bother as the default places are always used.

This commit also replaces 'auth=' by 'phase2=' in the configuration
template as the former is for a long time an alias of the latter and
removed in LibreSwan 3.19.

The virtual-private argument of 'ipsec pluto' has been put into the
configuration file to avoid commas(,) in the commandline so that the
netns_wrapper can work well.

A new tempest job for running LibreSwan as the device driver on CentOS 7
is also added to avoid regression.

This commit has been simply tested on CentOS 7.4 with the following
versions of LibreSwan provided by the CentOS repo:

  - libreswan-3.12-5.el7.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.12-10.1.el7_1.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.15-5.el7_1.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.15-8.el7.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.20-3.el7.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.20-5.el7_4.x86_64.rpm

and different versions of LibreSwan provided by libreswan.org[1]:

[1] https://download.libreswan.org/binaries/rhel/7/x86_64/

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
	neutron_vpnaas/tests/tempest/scenario/test_vpnaas.py
	neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py

Closes-Bug: #1711456
Closes-Bug: #1782337
Change-Id: Iacb6f13187b49cf771f0c24662d6af9217c211b8
(cherry picked from commit b6c8ea8a3cca39bb4138bc7063569352faeb612f)

commit_message:
Make libreswan driver work with recent versions

LibreSwan 3.19 introduces a new commandline argument '--nssdir' for
pluto which defaults to '/etc/ipsec.d'. As older versions don't
understand such an option, we cannot just add it to the commandline.

The commandline arguments of LibreSwan are not stable enough to rely on.
For example, in 3.19, 'ipsec initnss' has the new argument '--nssdir',
and in 3.20, 'ipsec pluto' also gets this new argument '--nssdir', then
in 3.22, the argument '--ctlbase' is phased out.

In this commit, instead of trying new options and then fallback to old
ones for older versions, the bind-mount method used in StrongSwan driver
is adopted. With /etc and /var/run bind mounted, all the commandline
arguments related to configuration file places can be removed. This
ensures that changes of such arguments between different versions won't
bother as the default places are always used.

This commit also replaces 'auth=' by 'phase2=' in the configuration
template as the former is for a long time an alias of the latter and
removed in LibreSwan 3.19.

The virtual-private argument of 'ipsec pluto' has been put into the
configuration file to avoid commas(,) in the commandline so that the
netns_wrapper can work well.

This commit has been simply tested on CentOS 7.4 with the following
versions of LibreSwan provided by the CentOS repo:

  - libreswan-3.12-5.el7.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.12-10.1.el7_1.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.15-5.el7_1.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.15-8.el7.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.20-3.el7.x86_64.rpm
  - libreswan-3.20-5.el7_4.x86_64.rpm

and different versions of LibreSwan provided by libreswan.org[1]:

[1] https://download.libreswan.org/binaries/rhel/7/x86_64/

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
	neutron_vpnaas/tests/tempest/scenario/test_vpnaas.py
	neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py

Change-Id: Iacb6f13187b49cf771f0c24662d6af9217c211b8
Closes-Bug: #1711456
Closes-Bug: #1782337
(cherry picked from commit b6c8ea8a3cca39bb4138bc7063569352faeb612f)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

subject: Add `python-pip` for openSUSE
messages:
[{'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Markos, could you double check this change? Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why only openSUSE? It seems that all distros are missing the pip package no?'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also see this

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/191e0b866018d43552064a1eb9f526671be16697

What problem are you seeing that makes you bring python-pip back?'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-05 19:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 20:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 20:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This is similar to 4e7e1c5104a3f03da9cf331ac021e443b25be72f

But given that we do not install pip anymore, it might be better to simply drop the call similar to 91e0b866018d43552064a1eb9f526671be16697

what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sorry the second SHA should be 191e0b866018d43552064a1eb9f526671be16697'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:45:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Is there a reason this is being done on Pike in particular? For Rocky & Stein we don't install pip on the hosts any more, but Queens and below needs it and uses get-pip.py to get it."}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 22:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Woah, that's amazing! I really didn't sneak a peak at your commit :)"}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-05 22:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Jesse, I see your point. Maybe just drop this part all together as Markos suggested?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-06 09:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I'm missing the point of the patch. Does that command fail because pip is not already there? If so, should it move until after get-pip.py puts it there? Are you specifically trying to make OpenSUSE work for Pike?

Queens has https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/stable/queens/scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh#L93 - is that not sufficient here?"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-06 09:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If the same as queens is fine, then perhaps https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/4e7e1c5104a3f03da9cf331ac021e443b25be72f should be ported back, rather than this be its own patch.'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-06 12:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes, it seems to only affect Pike. i'll port the other patch back."}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-09-06 12:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superceeded by backport'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 16:21:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add `python-pip` for openSUSE

On the OpenStack cloud image of Leap 42.3 `python-pip` is not
installed by default. This change adds this package.

Change-Id: Ica5676c60b81bdec8eb2477e149ff7ba4ab7c6d3

commit_message:
Add `python-pip` for openSUSE

On the OpenStack cloud image of Leap 42.3 `python-pip` is not
installed by default. Change the bootstrap script such that it does
not fail if pip isn't there.

Change-Id: Ica5676c60b81bdec8eb2477e149ff7ba4ab7c6d3

commit_message:
Ensure nova-compute service start after libvirtd

This patch aims to ensure that the nova-compute systemd service is
started only after the libvirtd systemd service.

This is a re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/593001
which is required due to the changes in how the services is setup.

Closes-Bug: 1780011
Co-Authored-By: kaiokassiano <kaiokmo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Change-Id: Ie9b6d83d4a9573be96e050376f756e97895b6e67

commit_message:
Consolidate create subnet operations in the same transaction

When a subnet is created, a new row is inserted in both DHCP_Options
and Port_Groups table. This patch is consolidating both inserts into
the same OVSDB transaction for consistency.

Change-Id: Id79dde4bb4a976b213af4a0a54e244547b1d757d
Closes-Bug: #1790839
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/594324/
Change-Id: I9b0e425e9e7ba0e59796092242c3cfed0ebf31f2
Story: #2002586
Task: #24324

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 16:36:25.000000000', 'message': 'Import the legacy grenade sahara job

While it would have been better to directly use a native Zuul v3 job,
the work towards a common grenade job seems to be stalled.
Import the job locally and fix some issues:
- make sure that the heat_tempest_plugin is loaded correctly,
  so that the heat upgrade tests work;
- bump the starting point from stable/ocata (!) to stable/queens;
  it will be changed to stable/rocky when grenade supports it;
  will require additional fixes due to the standalone->uwsgi change.
- import lib/apache so that wsgi deployment works.

This backport also:
- adds sahara-grenade to the gate queue,
- fixes the branches used for the upgrade,
  and use the released python-saharaclient

Story: 2001686
Task: 24517
Change-Id: Ia8de2b8286287355e8e9d3f702027aa282ed8282
(cherry picked from commit 5a3ae85cc1dc92203a4d29ac242b38f58d7dd24a)
(cherry picked from commit 63f37fb808158c749e756c211451db4fa8f28355)
'}]
commit_message:
Import the legacy grenade sahara job

While it would have been better to directly use a native Zuul v3 job,
the work towards a common grenade job seems to be stalled.
Import the job locally and fix some issues:
- make sure that the heat_tempest_plugin is loaded correctly,
  so that the heat upgrade tests work;
- bump the starting point from stable/ocata (!) to stable/queens;
  it will be changed to stable/rocky when grenade supports it;
  will require additional fixes due to the standalone->uwsgi change.
- import lib/apache so that wsgi deployment works.

This backport also:
- adds sahara-grenade to the gate queue,
- fixes the branches used for the upgrade,
  and use the released python-saharaclient

Story: 2001686
Task: 24517
Change-Id: Ia8de2b8286287355e8e9d3f702027aa282ed8282
(cherry picked from commit 5a3ae85cc1dc92203a4d29ac242b38f58d7dd24a)
(cherry picked from commit 63f37fb808158c749e756c211451db4fa8f28355)

Add experimental check for NPWG multi-vif driver

Add experimental check with NPWG multi-vif driver enabled, in
order to test the NPWG tempest case.

commit_message:
Use keystone client from manager

OpenDaylight V2 driver for ceilometer requires keystone client to fetch
admin project id for its meters. This change will enable the driver to use
keystone client from polling agent manager.

Change-Id: Iab3f210203d05f3e7ba550dfe35a0bdb5f099c31
Signed-off-by: Deepthi V V <deepthi.v.v@ericsson.com>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I5d9130aef1121255355463f8826f6eb6c20812cb
Story: #2002586
Task: #24324

commit_message:
Add check.yml for prometheus and vitrage

Without this, kolla-ansible check fails with the following error:

Unable to retrieve file contents
Could not find or access '/path/to/kolla-ansible/ansible/check.yml'"}

Also adds the check command to the CI tests, to ensure that it does not
break again.

Change-Id: I9fc2f9999f55cb742ac3ac38579dcf26524a9fc7
Closes-Bug: #1790653

commit_message:
Make search for config drive partition case insensitive

Currently the search for config drive is just done for config-2
in lowercase. If we pass the label with vfat, the label will
be in uppercase by convention. So the comparison will fail, and
this needs to be case insensitive to work.

Fixed argument from original backport due to changes that were
introduced later in ironic-lib.

Change-Id: I1dd196841fc3599333d68459eac606bd3b104b7b
Story: #2003547
Task: #24834
(cherry picked from commit 65b3df1aa8c08d1242274d2fa27bd4ea320bae61)

commit_message:
Remove unsued opensuse jobs

These jobs are not used any place, remove them from zuul configuration.
We can always add them back.

Change-Id: Ia503d6e302b5f5fd1a477d761d9e497056aec614
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
aodh/gnocchi: remove constraints on aggregation methods

The current list misses the percentile and all rate based aggregation methods.
Rather than adding them, let's remove the constraint and let Gnocchi and Aodh
validate the data.

Change-Id: I0330c09d72c20d63d08770b52d3071512a418260

(7 comments)

Thanks Sam and Shivanand!

commit_message:
Add OpenBMC class for accessing nodes using OpenBMC

This adds a class that handles operations against a node running
OpenBMC.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Hamzy <hamzy@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Kimball <adam.c.kimball@ibm.com>
Partial-Bug: #1634635
Change-Id: Ibb93240f17ed8b76fe9907542f7c17fe203be046

commit_message:
Remove legacy-opensuse-423 nodeset

Stop using legacy-opensuse-423 so we can remove it from
openstack-zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: I3f89f2dd633ab59200b89645b0d2930fe66e776d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

I'm still unsure about this.  We are building centos and fedora every time in the gate on ubuntu trusty, xenial and bionic gates and not seeing this.  clearly it's some small setting, but my strong preference would be to understand exactly what it is that causes this to fail, and if we understand that, we can put in a specific override"}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-06-18 11:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ian, if you follow the instructions given at https://gist.github.com/obourdon/ec35ddc455e5f621a81459fd39c7ee16, you should be able to very easily reproduce the issue. I am using very minimal ubuntu (and centos) images'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-06 10:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm now even more convinced we need to look more closely at this

[1] is this role running in the gate on a Xenial node building Centos images.  So it's not as simple as "debian based system".

Presumably, this is on an *non-selinux* capable system?

If that is the case -- is this even going to produce a valid image?  If we can't fix the context of the files inside the chroot, I'm not sure that's even a valid image.  

I've definitely had issues with Fedora images not booting due to bad selinux labels on files.  I think Iae0afe850f52ec3b59c49507fa9bbcc1c8f8cfa1 might be what I was talking about.

*Maybe* ... if you can't set the contexts here, you could set it up to autorelabel at boot time, with resulting boot time penalty of course.

I'd want to see investigation into all this before we just ignore the failure

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/76/588676/1/check/dib-dsvm-functests-python3/9487166/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-08-03_22_56_14_879597'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-06 11:55:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> ... Error connecting to audit system.

this appears to be [1]; if so this comes from audit_open() and isn't particularly related to selinux as such.  so the kernel you're building on doesn't have audit support?

[1] https://github.com/fedora-selinux/selinux/blob/master/policycoreutils/setfiles/setfiles.c#L112"}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ian, do you have a description somewhere on what are the details of the ubuntu image these tests are running on ? package list, configuration, ... ?'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Even though I think I understand most of the ins-and-outs here, I do not see why building a CentOS image should rely on some specificities of the running Ubuntu kernel and/or processes of the platform machine used to build this image'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-10 05:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> do you have a description somewhere on what are the details of the ubuntu image these tests are running on ? 

the build logs are all available on the nodepool builders, see [1] for example.  the elements are all in here or project-config, and are specified in nodepool configuration [2]

[1] https://nb01.openstack.org/ubuntu-xenial-0000001548.log 
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/nodepool/nodepool.yaml'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-08-13 07:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ian, sorry but even with the information provided I do not see what packages are installed on the Ubuntu nodepool servers
Is it possible for you to send me the output of dpkg -l + contents of /etc/lsb-release + ps -efH  from one of these servers. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-08-27 07:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

After trying https://review.openstack.org/591366 to understand why the CentOS images build on the Ubuntu xenial nodepools nodes and not on my own, I currently have absolutely
no clue on why the behaviour is different and what to try next.Ian, Yolanda, may be you have some ideas about this. May be if you could have a look at https://gist.github.com/obourdon/ec35ddc455e5f621a81459fd39c7ee16 which describe how to easily reproduce the issue this would be great. Many thanks'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-08-31 07:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-31 08:03:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Fix CentOS image build failure when dib runs on system where audit disabled

Without this fix, building a CentOS image on Ubuntu where audit=0 is passed
as a kernel boot parameter will lead to the following error:
disk-image-create centos7 dhcp-all-interfaces cloud-init-nocloud \
    devuser yum epel baremetal
... dib-run-parts Running tmpdir/hooks/cleanup.d/99-selinux-fixfiles-restore
... Error connecting to audit system.

Change-Id: I229d9b72f88bffddca42da57f01c27e902427071

Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

This replaces the deprecated (in python 3.2) unittest.TestCase method
assertRaisesRegexp() with assertRaisesRegex().

Change-Id: I0ac482741ad4adc1127dd9e9f64c1c8101f370e5
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix bootloader packages for aarch64

Due to the arm naming convention, building centos images for arm64 and
aarch64 does not yield the same result. In order to locate grub2 on
aarch64 the correct mapping is added.

Change-Id: I1bb227b2523e420e394fec8c52c6c79fcdd31c53
Closes-Bug:#1789414
Signed-off-by: Charalampos Kominos <Charalampos.Kominos@enea.com>

commit_message:
Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

[{'created': '2018-08-08 15:01:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix import style

Based on the current import style guide,
https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/coding-guidelines.html#import-style
it is recommended to not import a function directly, but instead
import the module and use module.function().

Do this for the is_distributed_router function in l3_hamode_db.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Ie52f3a2480f337d90535baed90a4b6d824d3a51f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix import style

Based on the current import style guide,
https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/coding-guidelines.html#import-style
it is recommended to not import a function directly, but instead
import the module and use module.function().

Do this for the is_distributed_router function in l3_hamode_db.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Ie52f3a2480f337d90535baed90a4b6d824d3a51f

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

Remove also unused tools/tox_install.sh, the existance breaks docs
building.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I2491e59c0801b76f92e00061ab46a09eff514008
Story: #2002586
Task: #24295

commit_message:
Allow filtering by arbitrary predicate and conductor_group

BREAKING: changed order of arguments in reserve_node.

BREAKING: changed exceptions inheriting ReservationFailed.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 09:40:17.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Disable inap-mtl01 provider""

This reverts commit 6b2f8bbfd58b91a6343422b299a5afe593ed991a.

It appears the mirror server has gone missing during the updates
(which is why we originally disabled this for a maintenance period).

Disable until we can rebuild

Change-Id: Ie5d7f9f9cd02c34bbfbea75eac44622c834d2c1a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Disable inap-mtl01 provider""

This reverts commit 6b2f8bbfd58b91a6343422b299a5afe593ed991a.

It appears the mirror server has gone missing during the updates
(which is why we originally disabled this for a maintenance period).

Disable until we can rebuild

Change-Id: Ie5d7f9f9cd02c34bbfbea75eac44622c834d2c1a

subject: Undercloud - non-local subnets only if routed networks enabled
messages:
[{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-09-06 08:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-09-06 10:06:44.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

We don't need this in instack-undercloud.
A pre-deploy validation ensures that routed networks is enabled when multiple subnets are specified.

Undercloud install failed.

Reason: Multiple subnets specified: ['ctlplane-subnet', 'leaf1', 'leaf2'] but routed networks are not enabled."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 08:49:26.000000000', 'message': 'Undercloud - non-local subnets only if routed networks enabled

Non local subnets should only be created when routed networks
is enabled in undercloud.conf.

Change-Id: I97a6e30454da638848cedb26fab37cbfa1851106
Related-Bug: #bug/1791034
'}]
commit_message:
Undercloud - non-local subnets only if routed networks enabled

Non local subnets should only be created when routed networks
is enabled in undercloud.conf.

Change-Id: I97a6e30454da638848cedb26fab37cbfa1851106
Related-Bug: #bug/1791034

commit_message:
Fix functional tests for Blazar

The functional test check the responsiveness of the Blazar API. A
return of 204 code from the API verifies the success.

Rest of the changes ensure compliance with all the standards required
to make the linter and docs tests pass.

Change-Id: I640877817ad1ae312436932af87ad15094616f12

commit_message:
Add channel feedback on 'book' command

We suppressed channel feedback for most actions, to keep
it quiet. However for the book action, it's good to show
that the command worked.

Change-Id: I4777ecbc854c3f00a3edf69ad30660ec636d3d37

commit_message:
Revert "Run with KVM if we can in tests"

The nested virt issues we saw on OVH should be resolved now.
More information here: I980cdbc67d6e7b3a8a2520b2279ff3a1cdf68c4b

This reverts commit 748e3d22925ff9cfe8baba087f37b26988f9e1e0.

Change-Id: If2adfc006ee9efb3f80e23d34311673b7c74d274
(cherry picked from commit a771ef5a03294a6763a38f9c15fec6e983a76b69)

[{'created': '2018-08-31 12:11:07.000000000', 'message': 'import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I10d50d987ec37e45a8af94c15af317a4dbc43f1b
Story: #2002586
Task: #24339
'}]
commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I10d50d987ec37e45a8af94c15af317a4dbc43f1b
Story: #2002586
Task: #24339

Before we merge this, I'd like to make sure that proper tests have been done: Running some pods (besides the infra ones) and that the scheduling is working as expected.

John, if you have an environment with this patch running, let me know and I'll help you verify the deployment."}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

resources.ServiceChain: Property error: resources[11].properties: Property DockerKeepalivedConfigImage not assigned'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-08-20 09:23:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> resources.ServiceChain: Property error: resources[11].properties: Property DockerKeepalivedConfigImage not assigned

I was hitting a similar issue and it was because I didn't explicitly set containerized_undercloud or containerized_overcloud to true in the quickstart config, which means undercloud-deploy/tasks/create-scripts.yml doesn't create containers-prepare-parameter.yaml, and the overcloud-prep-containers script silently fails when this is missing.

Probably at least one quickstart bug there as I'd expect both those variables to default to true, but not had time to work on a fix yet."}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-08-20 13:17:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> > resources.ServiceChain: Property error: resources[11].properties:
 > Property DockerKeepalivedConfigImage not assigned
 > 
 > I was hitting a similar issue and it was because I didn't
 > explicitly set containerized_undercloud or containerized_overcloud
 > to true in the quickstart config, which means undercloud-deploy/tasks/create-scripts.yml
 > doesn't create containers-prepare-parameter.yaml, and the
 > overcloud-prep-containers script silently fails when this is
 > missing.
 > 
 > Probably at least one quickstart bug there as I'd expect both those
 > variables to default to true, but not had time to work on a fix
 > yet.

Thanks for a direction to look, but in this case I think it must be something else. The containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is created:

http://logs.openstack.org/95/582495/13/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario009-multinode-oooq/eb9e67a/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/containers-prepare-parameter.yaml.txt.gz

I am able to reproduce this same issue without these new patches though... so I think we have broken scenario009 all together. Still looking at what might be the cause though."}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-08-20 13:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-08-20 13:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

In any case I put up a patch to add it (since a few other scenarios also seem broken by this) : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593621/1'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-08-24 09:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2018-07-13 13:52:47.000000000', 'message': "Move to openshift-ansible 3.10

This patch adds a new role called OpenShiftInfra which is required to
define infra nodes. We've been bundling infra nodes with compute and
master nodes and they ought to be independent.

With the new node label management introduced in openshift-ansible, it
sounds like this is a good time for us to unbundle these nodes.

Depends-On: I691a1ff894115babbf21a19f35483375d0202440
Change-Id: I4f8127a9e2d822057f3db8f0974ab1db0698985a

commit_message:
Move to openshift-ansible 3.10

This patch adds a new role called OpenShiftInfra which is required to
define infra nodes. We've been bundling infra nodes with compute and
master nodes and they ought to be independent.

With the new node label management introduced in openshift-ansible, it
sounds like this is a good time for us to unbundle these nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Martin AndrÃ© <m.andre@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I291b6ac65eaa1a015bca2ee2bc1be90b0ea0aadc
Change-Id: I4f8127a9e2d822057f3db8f0974ab1db0698985a

commit_message:
Add py3-dj21 tox env for Django 2.1

Django 2.1 has been released. It would be nice to have tox env
for testing with Django 2.1.

Note that this does not mean I lead Django 2.1 support.

Related-Bug: #1789046
Change-Id: Ic5f59e3c19480e01f5bfecbb0994121ee649388f

Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:51:42.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 20:26:06.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid UnhashableKeyWarning in api.nova.extension_supported

In python3, novaclient ListExtResource is not hashable.
An error message on UnhashableKeyWarning is emitted repeatedly
and this can pollute error log with unuseful messages.

A tuple of extension names are now passed to the memoized
decorator so that the decorator can hash it.

Change-Id: I7f200ee6ece36767586207dc26aed1325b909226
Closes-Bug: #1790930
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid UnhashableKeyWarning in api.nova.extension_supported

In python3, novaclient ListExtResource is not hashable.
An error message on UnhashableKeyWarning is emitted repeatedly
and this can pollute error log with unuseful messages.

A tuple of extension names are now passed to the memoized
decorator so that the decorator can hash it.

Change-Id: I7f200ee6ece36767586207dc26aed1325b909226
Closes-Bug: #1790930

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Move to openshift-ansible 3.10""

We need this for https://review.openstack.org/582495

There is a circular dependency, since this patch also needs the one
above, so I will workflow -1 this until they are ready to merge

commit_message:
Use atomic package from virt-sig for openshift job

The atomic package in centos extras has conflicts with the
python2-docker package in our master deps. This causes the
openshift job to fail when trying to install the atomic
package. We only add the virt-sig repo to this job, because
it is not mirrored anywhere.

Change-Id: Iaa3f90bd2e9bceb7496e8cb1ab5ce8063ba8c68e

commit_message:
Fix regex for python paunch package in repo config

The paunch package is named python2-paunch or python3-paunch, so we need
to update the regex to python*-paunch* to cover all paunch rpms.

Change-Id: I7d81d1c4af4a6117e45f7fff1fd4edde8ee4d3fe

commit_message:
Quote $PLAYBOOKS variable for sourcing

When $PLAYBOOKS variable is not quoted, it's impossible to source
it from the file because it contains spaces.

Change-Id: I8a8155845e52635d826dabdb5bc02e456b3f2421

commit_message:
Handle sparse resource registry in build_service_filter

During image prepare, the intent of build_service_filter is to filter
out services which are *known* to be not containerized, either because
they are puppet services, or have been mapped to 'OS::Heat::None'.

However if a partial resource registry is passed in, then this was
also filtering out the services with missing resource_registry
mappings. Since we're now assuming services are containerized by
default, this behaviour was cause many of the issues with missing or
no image parameters being generated.

Closes-Bug: #1727347
Change-Id: Ie65038e3ed73a77aeec9178231ab776ed26a2d84
(cherry picked from a26410ff9d32c05d7d59e1594510bf3f154f5f64)

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ie5c081e220763c54e64e5be00714b8dbd0a683f1

commit_message:
Ceph-storage-init : make configmap and secret names to be driven via chart values

This is make ceph configmap and admin keyring secret names using
in storage init scripts to be read  from chart values as we may
have two ceph clusters  gets activated in one namespace and
each ceph clsuter will have its own configmap and admin secret names.

Change-Id: I84d94f3ac21e602c50619e456ff327ae1da53622

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I57a394e864560987ded724b7dcd3054a1a5e5648

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I367d981d60f25408c56b401b3b8b28efdfde9d1d

a different site after a Horizon workflow.

commit_message:
Prevent open redirects on WorkflowView actions

Check that the 'next_url' is resolvable by Django
to prevent malicious links from unexpectedly directing the user to
a different site after a Horizon workflow.

For example:
/admin/flavors/create/?next=http://www.foobar.com/

Change-Id: Iedf70169ee0e5c71bbf8917a77c03860d96b1daf
Closes-Bug: 1625833

of `transfer-table`.

* Added `tr-change` which allows watching for changes when an
  item is removed or added
* Add validation for key pairs by handling `tr-change` event.

commit_message:
Fix `requires_keypair` support

The following patch introduces a few fixes for some problems
that were introduced from previous commits since the introduction
of `transfer-table`.

* Added `tr-change` which allows watching for changes when an
  item is removed or added
* Add validation for key pairs by handling `tr-change` event.

This should help make the migration towards `transfer-table`
much cleaner as there is no way to enforce a minimum item
before this patch.

Change-Id: Ie3d3ba01fc49fc9c141d002bbd87af359cd96545

(5 comments)

I think this fix misses the mark a bit. I think that appropriate fix is to add a policy target either through a mixin or in the allowed() method. Restoring the "is_admin" checks is a large step backward and even less flexible and in many cases inaccurate depending on your policy file.'}, {'account_id': 17172, 'date': '2016-08-01 06:11:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

@David Thank you for great feedback! I'll try to address.
And I have only one concern, which is table_action. In the case of row_action, we may know the target info. On the other hand, table_action doesn't have targets when a user open the panel. revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-08 11:50:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix so that a domain admin can create/delete users from table action.

At the moment when a user who have a domain admin privilege logged in,
this user cannot create/delete users because of their policy setting.
When we use domain scoped token, we assume that keystone v3 policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) is used.
In this case, some policy like 'delete_user' require 'target' info.
However when we display panel like User panel, target info doesn't exist.
Therefore, policy which is needed some target info will not work correctly.
This patch will address these issues.

Change-Id: I73858c3832ed8841bb72a9210dc6863b7f1bcaaf
Closes-Bug: #1600195

"}, {'created': '2016-08-18 07:54:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the issue that domain admin cannot manage own project, user and group correctly

At the moment, when a user who have a domain admin privilege logged in,
this user cannot do some operations even though the user has a enough privilege.
(When we use domain scoped token, we assume that keystone v3 policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) is used.)

 - cannot create/delete users(only modify)
 - cannot delete multiple project or group at the same time.
 - cannot modify members in a group

These are caused by not enough target info when policy check is done.
This patch will address these issues.

Change-Id: I73858c3832ed8841bb72a9210dc6863b7f1bcaaf
Closes-Bug: #1600195

commit_message:
Allow domain admin to manage own project/user/group correctly

At the moment, when a user who have a domain admin privilege logged in,
this user cannot do some operations even though the user has a enough
privilege.
(When we use domain scoped token, we assume that keystone v3
policy file(policy.v3cloudsample.json) is used.)

 - cannot create/delete users(only modify)
 - cannot delete multiple project or group at the same time.
 - cannot modify members in a group

These are caused by not enough target info when policy check is done.
This patch will address these issues.

Change-Id: I73858c3832ed8841bb72a9210dc6863b7f1bcaaf
Closes-Bug: #1600195

commit_message:
Fix server side search

Searching with column always sends list request.
This patch fixed it that send when columns have isServer attribute.

Co-Authored-By: Allen <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

Closes-Bug: #1702833
Change-Id: I5a92af3ad5056343989321ec365829a7c93c5bc0

subject: Use OS::Nova::HostAggregate instead of OS::Nova::Aggregate

to be associated with a resource type in OpenStack. Now that
Horizon is supporting adding metadata to instances (just got
in during the mitaka cycle - so unrealeased), I realized that
we used OS::Nova::Instance instead of OS::Nova::Server in Glance.
This doesnât align with Heat or Searchlight.

Horizon Issue:
The instance update metadata action and NG launch instance should
retrieve OS::Nova::Server instead. The Horizon patch shouldn't merge
until the glance patch merges, but there is not an actual hard
dependency between the two.

commit_message:
Use OS::Nova::HostAggregate instead of OS::Nova::Aggregate

The metadata definitions in etc/metadefs allow each namespace to
be associated with a resource type in OpenStack. We realized that
we used OS::Nova::Aggregate instead of OS::Nova::HostAggregate
in Glance. This doesnât align with Heat or Searchlight.
It should be noted that Heat added the resource type after Glance
had metadefs.

Horizon Issue:

The aggregate update metadata action should retrieve
OS::Nova::HostAggregate instead. The Horizon patch shouldn't merge
until the glance patch merges, but there is not an actual hard
dependency between the two. Horizon may need to request both in
order to be backwards compatible.

Depends-On: Ic6d676fb6a3d91ccfbed56bfad31ab20559a78f5

Closes-Bug:1612491
Change-Id: I5564a9070dc2ebb25ede084033ed16a4c60c4039

Since bug 1643100 is considered a duplicate of this ticket, please address the following issues in this patch as well:

1. On the Django launch instance modal, the help text message is overlapping with the next input label.
2. On the Djanog launch instance modal, the disabled flavors have the same styling as the enabled flavors. I think the disabled flavors should be gray out and unclickable.
3. Flavors with zero disk size should not be disabled for any boot sources with or without new volume.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2016-11-22 07:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Ying, you seem to be mixing stuff here. 

> 1. On the Django launch instance modal, the help text message is overlapping with the next input label.

Should be another bug, please create it.

> 2. On the Djanog launch instance modal, the disabled flavors have the same styling as the enabled flavors. I think the disabled flavors should be gray out and unclickable.

Same, this is a wishlist item, should be created as another bug

> 3. Flavors with zero disk size should not be disabled for any boot sources with or without new volume.

This is the only part from your original bug report that I can see that goes into the scope of this patch :)'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2016-11-22 17:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2016-11-03 11:34:56.000000000', 'message': "Skip flavor's diskcheck when making a volume

When creating a volume from an image during instance launch, the
flavor's disk should not be checked against the image's minimal disk
requirements.

Fixes bug 1638581

Change-Id: Ic869cf0bfa5f0666054a916779170de036425602
"}, {'created': '2016-11-03 11:37:54.000000000', 'message': "Skip flavor's diskcheck when making a volume

flavor's disk should not be checked against the image's minimal disk
requirements.

"}, {'created': '2016-11-03 12:51:00.000000000', 'message': "Skip flavor's diskcheck when making a volume

When creating a volume from an image during instance launch, the
flavor's disk should not be checked against the image's minimal disk

commit_message:
Skip flavor's diskcheck when making a volume

When creating a volume from an image during instance launch, the
flavor's disk should not be checked against the image's minimal disk
requirements.

This patch fixes both the angular UI and the traditional Django based
UI.

Closes-bug: #1638581

Change-Id: Ic869cf0bfa5f0666054a916779170de036425602

Looking at http://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/components/forms/ it looks like the form-inline class might have been added for consistency with bootstrap, to ensure bootstrap theming works correctly and to avoid using convoluted styling to get the horizontal styling that we use in horizon which is default with the 'form-inline' wrapper class.

This is now a pretty old patch and everything seems to work fine without it from what I can see, but adding this does not break anything and would have the above benefits as well."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 08:09:45.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 months without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in edit extra spec form

If submit edit extra spec form with empty value, it will raise AttributeError.
Due to the method '_populate_context'  has been redefined and not need to
call again.

Path: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/337703/7/horizon/forms/views.py

Change-Id: Ic131563b47a8bb0b9b7c445b9f312cc57986cece
Closes-bug: #1685822

I want to better understand. You're clearing the volume_type if a user sets it, but if they are creating a volume from another volume?

The user enters a value, then we wipe it? If the value is blank when the API call is made, it just uses the source type?

If we don't clear the value we get an error? Could we just add some form validation to point out the error rather than changing value out from under the user? OR we could unset the form field for type when volume source is selected."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-10-02 09:33:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Please, add unit-tests and address David's comments"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 08:08:50.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

commit_message:
Clear volume type when creating volume from volume

Creating a volume from another volume will result in an error if the
volume type of the target is set to something other than the volume type
of the source.  This is not normally a problem, but the dialog permits
the user to set the volume type before setting the source, which will
trigger an error if the volume types differ.

Change-Id: I59d9f01698707045bb0e3fdf6446e34511e8b47b
Closes-Bug: 1599225

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-25 13:34:19.000000000', 'message': 'No hostname validation in launch instance angularjs panel

Horizon Juno does not have hostname validation in AngularJS launch instance
form. For example, you can create a new instance with name: "#3rtttt"

That name will cause problems when Nova try to handle, but Horizon allow
launch a new instance with a not valid hostname. A valid hostname is
specified by RFC1123 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123).

This patch is quite similar to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1458800 but the validation
happens in different layers. This patch is needed as Horizon supports
the new AngularJS launch instance form.

Change-Id: I378ba917594a25319cebb623200d0f21b03a7ca5
Closes-Bug: #1490850

commit_message:
Add hostname validation in launch instance angularjs panel

Horizon does not have hostname validation in AngularJS launch instance
form. For example, you can create a new instance with name: "#3rtttt"

That name will cause problems when Nova try to handle, but Horizon allow
launch a new instance with a not valid hostname. A valid hostname is
specified by RFC1123 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123).

Change-Id: I378ba917594a25319cebb623200d0f21b03a7ca5
Closes-Bug: #1490850

subject: Fix 'Launch Instance' workflow initialization

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-21 14:00:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'Launch Instance' workflow initialization

Using legacy way to launch instance via
'http://horizon_url/project/instances/launch' sometimes wizard is not
loaded properly due to browsers script loading and initialization. This
leads to 'horizon'instances' module is not loaded when we try to use it
from the template's inline script.

Since jQuery is included in the <head> it's safe to use it to wait until
page is loaded and initialize Launch Instance workflow.

Change-Id: Id1599e16ab29748bcd844ec13f9fd0d37e647e58
Related-Bug: #1715066
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'Launch Instance' workflow initialization

Using legacy way to launch instance via
'http://horizon_url/project/instances/launch' sometimes wizard is not
loaded properly due to browsers script loading and initialization. This
leads to 'horizon'instances' module is not loaded when we try to use it
from the template's inline script.

Since jQuery is included in the <head> it's safe to use it to wait until
page is loaded and initialize Launch Instance workflow.

Change-Id: Id1599e16ab29748bcd844ec13f9fd0d37e647e58
Related-Bug: #1715066

commit_message:
WIP: Show virtual size as image size in image list

The following commit changes what image size is shown in the launch
instance screen:
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/commit/b4005d0871611c3717c88b2433a83dda627b6c56

This commit makes the image size shown in the image panel behave the same way.

Closes-Bug: #1641200
Change-Id: I46e8a8f6b0ec77097f54e0fed8f03888613954cb

This patch allows the form to be submitted with federated login, but there are two issues when the auth type is credentials: 1) The error message is shown twice. It can be reproduced by entering the incorrect credentials. 2) When the required fields are missing, a pop up message is shown while there should be an error message shown below the form field. The whole issue is caused by html5 validation being enabled. I think a better fix would be just adding the novalidate attribute to the form tag on _login_form.html to disable the html5 validation.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-10-30 20:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Alternative at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/516439/'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-01 17:01:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-01 17:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> 1) The error message is shown twice. It can be reproduced by entering the incorrect credentials.

I took a stab at fixing this problem

> 2) When the required fields are missing, a pop up message is shown while there should be an error message shown below the form field.

This is the result of client-side validation, the red error message only appears after failing server-side validation.

> The whole issue is caused by html5 validation being enabled. I think a better fix would be just adding the novalidate attribute to the form tag on _login_form.html to disable the html5 validation.

There seems to be some objection to this approach: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/516439/'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 08:08:21.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 months without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
WEBSSO should not require username/password

As federated login does not use any of the textboxes in the login
screen, these should not be marked as required when anything but
'credentials' is selected.  This solution uses ng-if to remove the
username/password fields from the DOM when federation is selected. This
requires a few workarounds because of the way forms are set up.

A positive side effect of this commit is that it also fixes a small bug
where submit button's label 'Connect' and 'Sign In' would not toggle
when using federation.

Change-Id: Ida0a8a5d23f39bda2ebd8731bf62f9b7d57580dc
Closes-Bug: #1703109

What if I change it to
"Scheduling creation of 1 instance" and
"Scheduling creation of N instances" ?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-10-30 07:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

To me "scheduling creation ..." is much more confusing.

creation of what? If it is a server as nova resource, the server resource is already created when a response is returned. As you see, we can check the status and state of the server resource via CLI or GUI. Are you expecting some VM or bare-metal server deployed?'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2017-11-03 03:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-07 03:22:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

-1 to gather attentions from the author. I describe why 'scheduled' is confusing in a reply comment."}, {'account_id': 23866, 'date': '2017-11-07 17:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> -1 to gather attentions from the author. I describe why 'scheduled'
 > is confusing in a reply comment.

I don't think I have any suggestions that are much better; Maybe 'scheduling' or 'building' - but everything comes with a downside when I think thoroughly about it.

From an end user perspective, I think a message that says "launched" or "created" - with the success class set - implies success at a point we do not know, and I find that misleading.  I think that the nova resource ending in error state (which is basically not much more than a row in the database) shouldn't have initially returned a message indicating success.

My opinions about this matter doesn't reach much further than that I wanted to fix a bug, I agreed with the poster, and it looked fairly easy.

So my suggestions are, in this order: scheduled, scheduling, and building.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 08:07:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 months without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
Clarify instance state after launch submission

After submitting a launch instance-workflow, an instance is technically
only scheduled for launch - and not yet actually launched.  This patch
reflects this in the message presented in the top right corner.

Change-Id: I1ae76e026fbb1e95c15d00f983b4eb2468242d76
Closes-bug: #1287051

I'm not altogether clear what the benefit of this patch is. Can you clarify this more? Testing the patch the only difference I can see is that it takes longer for the instance to show on the graph after being launched in the CLI. I am very happy to be corrected if I am missing something! Thanks :)"}, {'account_id': 26546, 'date': '2017-09-17 10:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello,

sure. Enter the network topology screen and switch to the graph view tab. The data for this graph gets reloaded via AJAX every half a minute or so and when this happens, the graph is redrawn. Without the patch, the graph moves around when this happens.

You may need to watch closely to see this - sometimes, the change is very minor.

It tends to be more observable for larger graphs, where sometimes the nodes jump around quite aggressively.'}, {'account_id': 26576, 'date': '2017-09-17 12:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 26546, 'date': '2017-12-01 14:01:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 08:07:52.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-13 06:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'Makes sure the simulation is advanced only on initial draw

When the graph was updated with data synced from the server
(a periodic operation), the D3 simulation was advanced by 100
ticks to set up the graph before being drawn to prevent the
graph from moving around too much when when drawn.

This patch changes this behavior to only happen when the graph
is first being drawn to prevent the graph from being moved
around on every update before being drawn.

Change-Id: Idf62178f7930bb1f02395b7ddadf26147130e9b0
Closes-Bug: 1716834
'}]
commit_message:
Makes sure the simulation is advanced only on initial draw

When the graph was updated with data synced from the server
(a periodic operation), the D3 simulation was advanced by 100
ticks to set up the graph before being drawn to prevent the
graph from moving around too much when when drawn.

This patch changes this behavior to only happen when the graph
is first being drawn to prevent the graph from being moved
around on every update before being drawn.

Change-Id: Idf62178f7930bb1f02395b7ddadf26147130e9b0
Closes-Bug: 1716834

There is a change in app.module.js around the use of rootScope that is not mentioned in the change log, and is unrelated to the debug data flag (AFAICT).'}, {'account_id': 13805, 'date': '2015-11-19 05:30:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Richard,

The change in app.module.js is needed for disabling ng-data. Previously, it tried to get a scope from a DOM element by this code:

angular.element('body').scope();

The returned value is the scope data bound to body element, which is $rootScope in this case, because the body element is the root element where the root angular module initialized and root scope is attached. If ng-data is disabled, the $rootScope no longer be able to be retrieved from DOM element any more. The change made in this file gets the $rootScope from DI rather than from element, it is related and must be included in this patch."}, {'account_id': 13805, 'date': '2015-11-19 05:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13805, 'date': '2015-11-19 05:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

patch set 6 fixed eslint errors.'}, {'account_id': 13805, 'date': '2015-11-19 05:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Looks good to me but I would like to see a bug opened for the error that this patch also fixes for tracking issues.'}, {'account_id': 14307, 'date': '2016-02-29 17:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Thanks @Itxaka.

The change to app.module.js is not a separate bug fix. When angular debug data is disabled, the scope is no longer attached to the DOM.  This means that "angular.element('body').scope( )" returns undefined when not in debug mode.  Instead, we must get scope from the $scope or $rootScope service, which works in both debug and normal mode.'}, {'account_id': 14307, 'date': '2016-02-29 21:25:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 14307, 'date': '2016-02-29 21:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

[{'created': '2015-11-18 22:32:36.000000000', 'message': 'Disabling debug data for production

AngularJS attaches the scope to the DOM for debugging purposes. We
should disable this in production environments. This patch reads from the
DEBUG flag in settings.py and sets the ng version accordingly.

See https://docs.angularjs.org/guide/production for more information.

Change-Id: Ib529fd4a44767a3a7e78b273332656692f777c8a

commit_message:
Disabling debug data for production

AngularJS attaches the scope to the DOM for debugging purposes. Disable
this in production environments. This patch reads from the DEBUG flag
in settings.py and sets the Angular debug mode accordingly.

See https://docs.angularjs.org/guide/production for more information.

As part of this change, we must also adjust code that gets scope objects
from the DOM. Instead, use the $rootScope service.

For example, "angular.element('body').scope()" returns undefined when
Angular debug is turned off. You can use this same line in the browser
console to test if Angular debug mode is enabled or not.

Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tyr Johansonn <tyr@hpe.com>

Change-Id: Ib529fd4a44767a3a7e78b273332656692f777c8a
Implements: blueprint angular-performance-disabling-debug-data

[{'created': '2017-08-28 12:00:21.000000000', 'message': 'Creates an interface for user settings

Creates an abstract class (UserSettings) which defines functions for
writing and reading user settings by horizon. Implementations of this
interface may be used to change the storage method used for user settings.

The implementation used to store user settings is selected by setting the
value of USER_SETTINGS_HANDLER in settings.py in the form: module.class.

example: USER_SETTINGS_HANDLER = "horizon.utils.SessionUserSettings"

commit_message:
Creates an interface for user settings

Creates an abstract class (UserSettings) which defines functions for
writing and reading user settings by horizon. Implementations of this
interface may be used to change the storage method used for user settings.

The implementation used to store user settings is selected by setting the
value of USER_SETTINGS_HANDLER in settings.py in the form: module.class.

example: USER_SETTINGS_HANDLER = "horizon.utils.SessionUserSettings"

where SessionUserSettings is a classe extending the abstract UserSettings
class.

If the user setting handling class is not set, a default implementation
us used; this implementation uses the default session and cookie based
system originally implemented in horizon.

Change-Id: I8c6b7472e3f4bacf3169a758ff1a1dcd1282a1c0
Closes-Bug: 1713478
Co-Authored-By: ales.krivak@ultimum.io

selected image to be de-allocated when an instance is being

commit_message:
Remove changeBootSource call

Calling the function in updateBootSourceSelection causes the
selected image to be de-allocated when an instance is being
launched from an image.

Change-Id: I22521865f6fc956094588956ce5c5f4bde8b20c7
Closes-Bug: #1704908

subject: Raise appropriate error if failed to upload image

@Galyna I am fixing the issue stated in https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1630833 . However it is similar to the problem you. You can download my patch to see if that fix your problem. You need make sure your settings images_panel is true. 


ANGULAR_FEATURES = {
    'images_panel': True,
    'flavors_panel': False,
    'users_panel': True,
    'roles_panel': True,
    'domains_panel': True,
    'instances_panel': True
}"}, {'account_id': 22724, 'date': '2017-04-26 10:30:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Raise appropriate error if failed to upload image

When creating new image, glance can deny uploading image
because it exceeds the .quota defined in glance-api configuration
file.
This patchi attempts to report this error to a UI user.

Change-Id: I12ba585f9046a632d8b4ad86439e8ff7c6ce0b92
Closes-Bug: #1270817

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-01 21:27:40.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance Project/Admin Instance tables to page backward

Currently the Project/Admin Instance tables can only page forward.
This patchset is to enhance nova api to support paging backward.

Steps to reproduce this issue:
1. In the user settings, set the Item per page as 3.
2. On the project -> Instance page, launch 6 instances.
3. You should see 3 instances per page in the instance table.
4. Click the "Next" link.
6. Notice that the "Prev" link is missing.

With this patchset, users should see a "Prev" link in the middle or last page
when they are doing paging.

Change-Id: I458e4d54eca1901f4f49db8738b27d755992ade0
Closes-Bug: #1426604
'}, {'created': '2015-03-03 17:27:02.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance Project/Admin Instance tables to page backward

commit_message:
Enhance Project/Admin Instance tables to page backward

Currently the Project/Admin Instance tables can only page forward.
This patch set is to enhance nova api to support paging backward.

With this patch set, users should see a "Prev" link in the middle or
last page
when they are doing paging.

Change-Id: I458e4d54eca1901f4f49db8738b27d755992ade0
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Closes-Bug: #1274427

subject: Add abiltiy for users to self provision

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22093, 'date': '2017-05-12 01:45:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is primarily a stopgap. Pike should offer more flexibility here. However, the problem currently is that a user cannot enable MAC learning through the UI simply because there is no toggle for port security. A more elegant solution to this patch would be to add a checkbox for port security, and tie it to the MAC learning checkbox in a way that if MAC learning is selected, the checkbox for port security is automatically cleared. 

I'm not sure how much work I should spend on this right now, given Pike is around the corner, but I'm interested in the feedback nonetheless."}, {'account_id': 18940, 'date': '2017-05-12 10:00:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The checkbox for port security is already there, try to rebase your devstack. But it doesn't clear the security groups (I wasn't allowed to do it)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-16 04:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-08 03:17:09.000000000', 'message': 'Enabling MAC learning needs to also remove security groups and port security

When MAC learning is enabled, port security must be disabled and security groups
must be removed in most platforms.  Consequently when MAC learning is disabled
port security must be added back to the port.

Change-Id: I1a6f91b382d18b7365e272b97057052ec668aea8
Closes-Bug: #1648011
'}]
commit_message:
Enabling MAC learning needs to also remove security groups and port security

When MAC learning is enabled, port security must be disabled and security groups
must be removed in most platforms.  Consequently when MAC learning is disabled
port security must be added back to the port.

Change-Id: I1a6f91b382d18b7365e272b97057052ec668aea8
Closes-Bug: #1648011
