commit_message:
Initalize themable selects only once.

We don't want to reinitialize selects that have already been
initialized.

Closes-bug: #1617001
Change-Id: Ide2c81a52f59f7f736b162e4e3cf31bb68b58b42

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I94ea2a4ca08edbf7ec2dc4139dd5d93dab6c5180
Story: #2002586
Task: #24760

commit_message:
Missing units of RAM in Launch instance Wizard

 -Added units(MB) to the Total RAM in flavor of Launch instance Wizard

Closes-Bug: #1641830

Change-Id: I7329f767b333f302906a8218d09a67d51277c8c9

Hi @Matthias! Did you mean -- we need blueprint instead bug ?'}, {'account_id': 9981, 'date': '2015-04-09 14:50:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The configuration sample and naming (putting it in utils) imply that this code changes the behavior of django.core.cache.backends.memcached.MemcachedCache to respect additional parameters. I don't think that really what you've provided right? this is an alternative backend to django.core.cache.backends.memcached.MemcachedCache.

If I understand correctly, then I suggest
1) put the file in horizon/backends/memcached.py and name the class HorizonMemcached to help make it clearer that it is a backend, not a utility
2) clean up the local_settings example so that it references this backend, or doesn't reference the additional parms known only to this backend
3) document this new backend in https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/doc/source/topics/deployment.rst#session-storage"}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2015-04-10 05:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

yeah, this sounds more of a BP than a bug.

Can you open a bp please?'}, {'account_id': 12355, 'date': '2015-04-10 09:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12355, 'date': '2015-04-10 09:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add backend for Horizon memcache

Use this backend for Memcached(python-memcached),
instead django-backend. Now, we can set delay to 0sec.
Added memcache-wrapper for extension python-memcache.

Implements: blueprint horizon-memcached
Closes-bug: 1441522
Change-Id: I4131521f82364e800d42bd69806bebb397b27a2e

-cinder type-create ssd
-cinder type-create hdd

commit_message:
Switch cinder to usage quotas

This change enables horizon to show cinder usage quotas. The
usage quotas provide both usage and the quota/limit for the
project in a single api, and the usage quotas provide more in
depth information to all the storage backend possibilities.

Co-Authored-By: Brad Pokorny <Brad_Pokorny@symantec.com>

Change-Id: I34203e7aa61f1ee1d91fe2dea44c580a5da675c4
Implements: blueprint horizon-use-quotas-api

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-13 11:01:31.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]Modify create/update Project in case that "compute" service is disabled

At the moment, if "compute" service is disabled, quota tab will be hidden
in create/update project. However, when operator create/update project,
quota update error will occur even though operator couldn't see quota
tab. This patch will fix this problem.

Change-Id: I26cd91e1ebbab91fd13d691368987fe414f25edb
Closes-Bug: #1591954
'}, {'created': '2016-06-13 11:41:23.000000000', 'message': 'Modify create/update Project in case that "compute" service is disabled

commit_message:
Modify create/update Project in case that "compute" service is disabled

At the moment, if "compute" service is disabled, quota tab will be hidden
in create/update project. However, when operator create/update project,
quota update error will occur even though operator couldn't see quota
tab. This patch will fix this problem.

Change-Id: I26cd91e1ebbab91fd13d691368987fe414f25edb
Closes-Bug: #1591954

subject: Update NG toast service to use HORIZON_CONFIG's auto_fade_alerts

commit_message:
Update NG toast service to use HORIZON_CONFIG's auto_fade_alerts

Retrieve the HORIZON_CONFIG auto_fade_alerts setting from settings
for the Angular toast service to use

Remove from conf.js (so we can remove it after Diana's spinner
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313685/ and this patch get merged)

Test it out by copying the changes from local_settings.py.example,
setting your alert fade delay to something like 100/10000 (default is 3000)
and see how it affects a toast.

Change-Id: Ia69d70665e1989a4f4b441da463a2ee36ed5d01f
Closes-Bug: #1602857

commit_message:
Volume Type Extra Spec key-value creation doesn't validate blank spaces

Added validation to check if empty values are entered in key and values fields
Thrown error if given empty.

Change-Id: I79943d53d53bd1b6fa13b8402b700e5d567a20f3
Closes-Bug: #1608351

I see an inconsistency in how Volume Types->Extra Specs work vs. QoS Specs->Manage specs.

So, you with your patch the first action shows a table within a modal, and then if we Create/Edit/Delete Extra specs, we're redirected to another page.

Compare this with the behavior of QoS Specs->Manage specs, where any similar Create/Edit/Delete action in the similar table within a modal causes a redirect to the main page (containing both Volume Types & QoS Specs), with the Specs column for a particular spec updated.

I opt for a consistent behavior and see redirecting to the same page (with column update) as a preferable solution."}, {'account_id': 16769, 'date': '2016-02-22 16:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16769, 'date': '2016-02-22 16:26:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I see an inconsistency in how Volume Types->Extra Specs work vs.
 > QoS Specs->Manage specs.

 > So, you with your patch the first action shows a table within a

 > redirected to another page.

 > any similar Create/Edit/Delete action in the similar table within a
 > modal causes a redirect to the main page (containing both Volume
 > Types & QoS Specs), with the Specs column for a particular spec
 > updated.
 > 
 > I opt for a consistent behavior and see redirecting to the same
 > page (with column update) as a preferable solution.

Hello Timur,

I have switched the URL redirection to have both modal success redirections take you back to the main index Volume Types tab page.  I hope this is what you meant.  Let me know what you think!

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-02-22 17:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

[{'created': '2016-01-11 20:38:04.000000000', 'message': "Fixed the Volume QoS manage specs table size issue

The QoS Specs table on the details page of Admin -> Volumes
-> Manage Specs is too small.  The issue I found was that the '_index.html'
page (https://goo.gl/VSZD2Q) is extending from '_modal.html' which is
squishing the table to modal size.  To solve this issue, I simply deleted
that '_index.html' file and edited the 'index.html' page (https://goo.gl/V3MCR5)
to follow what most other similar pages do. The table width is now full sized
and looks as it should!

Change-Id: I23851c50fcfed0ec082bf669ff89c989758b86cf
Closes-Bug: #1525410

"}, {'created': '2016-01-19 15:52:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed the Volume Type and QoS specs table size issues

The Admin Volume Types and QoS Specs tables appear to be squished.
This can seen by right clicking on either Volume Types --> "View
Extra Specs" or QoS Specs --> "Manage Specs" actions and opening
the link in a new tab/page.  The issue I found was that the
'index.html' pages for these two resources was including the
'_index.html'page, which extends the modal form and thus squishes
the table to modal size.  To solve this issue, I simply removed the
include of the '_index.html" pages and just rendered the table in
the index file itself.  The tables are now full width and look as
they should.

Change-Id: I23851c50fcfed0ec082bf669ff89c989758b86cf
Closes-Bug: #1525410

commit_message:
Fixed the Volume Type and QoS specs table size issues

The Admin Volume Types and QoS Specs tables appear to be squished.
This can seen by right clicking on either Volume Types --> "View
Extra Specs" or QoS Specs --> "Manage Specs" actions and opening
the link in a new tab/page.  The issue I found was that the
'index.html' pages for these two resources was including the
'_index.html'page, which extends the modal form and thus squishes
the table to modal size.  To solve this issue, I simply removed the
include of the '_index.html" pages and just rendered the table in
the index file itself.  The tables are now full width and look as
they should.

Change-Id: I23851c50fcfed0ec082bf669ff89c989758b86cf
Closes-Bug: #1525410

commit_message:
Modified form of creating volume from a snapshot submit behavior.

Currently, when creating volume from a snapshot, you will get a
mismatched form after an invalid submission.

This change adds post function to volume create interface form.
allowing user to go back into the form after an invalid submission.

Change-Id: I686e49b7650953348fce98f735ac80b0dd369b94
Closes-Bug: 1642910

commit_message:
merge "Edit Host Aggregate" and "Manage Hosts" into one tabbed modal

As mentioned in Bug #1290618, the behavior of these two table row
actions was inconsistent with other panels.
1. This patch corrects the UX, makes the two actions focus on the
   different tab in one workflow modal.
2. To follow out DRY, some refactories are applied to reuse the code and
   template in create aggregate workflow.
3. The corresponding unit tests are adjusted to fit this change.

Change-Id: Icaed4c217c316a2605b30ef22e1ce533feeccbda
Closes-Bug: #1290618

subject: Indicate which hosts are already in an AZ in 'all available hosts' list

commit_message:
Indicate which hosts are already in an AZ in 'all available hosts' list

  -This patch is related to name field already exists,display the error
   message before creating host

closes-bug: #1637262

Change-Id: I3bd9d5d91099131036c5cf85626e15c9c22abc8e

commit_message:
Added support for tenant metadata

Metadata modal and sevice updated to handle keystone project metadata.
Metadata is stored as a serialized json in tenant's description field.
Metadata overwrites existing description.

Change-Id: I532b8a556cb07a4d5d562d116c17a252808e4178
Implements:blueprint ability-to-add-metadata-to-keystone-projects
Co-Authored-By: Nikita Konovalov <nkonovalov@mirantis.com>

subject: Networks panel can't be actually disabled

[{'created': '2017-01-31 11:31:23.000000000', 'message': " Networks panel can't be actually disabled

commit_message:
Networks panel can't be actually disabled

  1.Disabling networks panel in Project,admin networks panel should work.
  2.Maintained common templates used by both Project and Admin separately.
  3.Templates path horizon/openstack_dashboard/templates/networks/

This patch is taken from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408583/

Change-Id: I1fa4a223bf45ca668824951ac55eb706718de4c3
Closes-Bug: #1321865

commit_message:
Fix User logged out when switch a project with non-admin role.
This fixes the problem now and there are still some problems in
using angular partly. An angular solution is in need
when the route system completely uses angular.
Closes-Bug: #1678204

Change-Id: I76f493cda4bd0503a19eaaf183ed09ed228d417c

commit_message:
Allocation FIP: Pool without IPv4 subnet is shown in the FIP pool list

Pools without ipv4 subnets are shown in the pool list. To hide them,
check if the pool's subnets returened in floating_ips/views.py
includes ipv4 subnet before appending the pool to the list.

Change-Id: I53fb936515913e298a772adfd14046dbe6e68a5c
Closes-Bug: #1689011

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-02-22 19:48:04.000000000', 'message': 'Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

Change-Id: Ib842a50c0a2933fb6fd63661e58415064290c138
'}, {'created': '2016-02-23 00:55:44.000000000', 'message': "Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

The Compute -> Access & Security -> Floating IPs tab should provide
the Associate button for FIPs that are already associated.
The nova CLI allows a user to associate an already associated FIP,
with the behavior being that the FIP is transferred from one VM to another.

A single API call to nova associates the IP with the new VM and
disassociates it from the old VM. The CLI behavior is especially
useful for service IP's, where switching an IP from one VM to
another quickly is important.

Closes-Bug: #1518134

Change-Id: Ib842a50c0a2933fb6fd63661e58415064290c138

commit_message:
Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

The Compute -> Access & Security -> Floating IPs tab should provide
the Associate button for FIPs that are already associated.
The nova CLI allows a user to associate an already associated FIP,
with the behavior being that the FIP is transferred from one VM to another.

A single API call to nova associates the IP with the new VM and
disassociates it from the old VM. The CLI behavior is especially
useful for service IP's, where switching an IP from one VM to
another quickly is important.

Closes-Bug: #1518134

Change-Id: Ib842a50c0a2933fb6fd63661e58415064290c138

commit_message:
Instances column is shortened so it fits properly

The 'Time since created' column name has been shortened to 'Age'
in project instances and admin instances meaning it fits properly
in table header cell and doesn't cause table header height to
increase

closes bug: #1614287

Change-Id: I960988bef684af5621ee52b3a13911755f7f25b4

commit_message:
Set admin password for instance in Angular

Now we can't set admin password for instance in angular form, this
patch fixed this.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 07:36:58.000000000', 'message': "Refactors network topology into angular elements

IMPORTANT: This is still WIP, but the general outline is
there. For review/debug/testing:

- settings.ANGULAR_TOPOLOGY = True enables the feature as
  a new tab in the network topology panel
- settings.ANGULAR_DEBUG_MODEL = True enables a model
  debugging UI instead of using live server data

NOTE: A series of debug components exist for
development and are not meant for the final version
of this patch.

Visualisation is divided into separate compoments:

- Network-topology serves as the central component tying
  all of the functionality together
- Topology-graph wraps D3 displaying code. It should
  be as general (and generic) as possible for potential
  reuse in different contexts
- Popup-balloon contains the logic related to the popups
  displayed when clicking individual nodes in the graph
- button-bar and checkbox-button are utility components
  used in the UI

In addition to the visualisation elements, data handling
has also been refactored and moved into angular elements:

- Topology-model.service contains code which handles the
  reception of data from the server, it's mapping and
  comparison with cached data for full diffing support
  (data is modified, deleted and created on synch).

  This service is meant as the central model store
  (Single source of truth). This data store should
  never be modified outside of the server synching
  mechanism; any components that need to modify data
  should create local working copies (data immutability).

- Topology-graph.factory is the factory function that
  takes the stored model data and creates a graph-like
  data structure of nodes and edges which are then
  used for D3 display.

  These elements are bound as D3 data when displayed.
  Any purely visual operations
  (Network Collapsing) should be carried out
  at this level, NOT at the model level.

Intended as a continuation of the work done in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199063/

Change-Id: I88bc057d2e34e2a683b0c494530b19c8d560cd86
Implements: blueprint curvature-network-topology

commit_message:
Refactors network topology (GRAPH) into angular elements

IMPORTANT: This is still WIP, but the general outline is
there. For review/debug/testing:

- settings.ANGULAR_TOPOLOGY = True enables the feature as
  a new tab in the network topology panel
- settings.ANGULAR_DEBUG_MODEL = True enables a model
  debugging UI instead of using live server data

NOTE: A series of debug components exist for
development and are not meant for the final version
of this patch.

Visualisation is divided into separate compoments:

- Network-topology serves as the central component tying
  all of the functionality together
- Topology-graph wraps D3 displaying code. It should
  be as general (and generic) as possible for potential
  reuse in different contexts
- Popup-balloon contains the logic related to the popups
  displayed when clicking individual nodes in the graph
- button-bar and checkbox-button are utility components
  used in the UI

In addition to the visualisation elements, data handling
has also been refactored and moved into angular elements:

- Topology-model.service contains code which handles the
  reception of data from the server, it's mapping and
  comparison with cached data for full diffing support
  (data is modified, deleted and created on synch).

  This service is meant as the central model store
  (Single source of truth). This data store should
  never be modified outside of the server synching
  mechanism; any components that need to modify data
  should create local working copies (data immutability).

- Topology-graph.factory is the factory function that
  takes the stored model data and creates a graph-like
  data structure of nodes and edges which are then
  used for D3 display.

  These elements are bound as D3 data when displayed.
  Any purely visual operations
  (Network Collapsing) should be carried out
  at this level, NOT at the model level.

Intended as a continuation of the work done in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199063/

Change-Id: I88bc057d2e34e2a683b0c494530b19c8d560cd86
Implements: blueprint angular-network-topology

commit_message:
Use ctrl.resourceType rather than hardcode

We defined ctrl.resourceType in controller, but we use hardcode
"OS::Neutron::QoSPolicy" in html file, use ctrl.resourceType will
be more resonable.

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/network_qos/details/overview.controller.js

Change-Id: I72a9fd7dc0fa3c493807f784cb1d1f1bac1ea34c

commit_message:
Fix the 409 error for confirm/revert resize instance

Because of the row_class UpdateRow,If the line of instances table refresh
the state and the instance did not complete resize,we can continue to click
to confirm or revert resize and the nova will be throw the Conflict error.

Change-Id: I1e10ececde84b7d8cf9d2022cd547af616730da8
Closes-Bug: #1732320

subject: Horizon now uses oslo-log
messages:
[{'account_id': 27838, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27838, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-24 17:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Could you clarify how django logging format and oslo.log formatter (like logging_default_format_string and logging_context_format_string) can co-exist?

Django logging settings (LOGGING in settings.py) allows operators to specify almost all logging configurations (as you may know).

I first would like to understand the relationship of oslo.log context formatter and django configuration correctly. Can we use all django logging settings? Anyway,  the configuration documentation must describe how the proposed patch works in detail.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-24 17:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As of now, this -1 is very near to -2 (due to my question in my previous comment).'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:46:04.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 months without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

Horizon now uses oslo-log

Moving from default Python logging module to oslo-log

Partial-implements: blueprint horizon-oslo-log

subject: Drop the "Open Console" link from the instance's ballon
messages:
[{'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-06 20:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-07 03:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You also need to clean up the related JavaScript codes.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-07 19:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-07 19:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-07 19:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-08 17:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-11-08 20:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16628, 'date': '2017-11-09 14:28:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I think a lot of users will miss this button and it should either remain or there should be at least a release note for this to make users aware of this change and where they can find the console now. 

Also, please clarify 'ballon' in commit message."}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-09 15:23:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Beth,

users can find the console link easily when they click "View Instance Details" link and are led to the instance page.

And when mouse cursor hovers over the instance icon in the network topology page, you would see the "balloon" of the instance. I used the "ballon" word because the html is named after "_balloon_container.html".'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-09 16:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

open_console_label definitions in horizon.flatnetworktopology.js and horizon.networktopology.js are also unnecessary anymore.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-09 16:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The background on this change is discussed in the bug report itself and we agreed to drop "Open Console" link.

It is worth having a release note on this (as this is a user visible change).

In addition, there are some codes in horizon.flatnetworktopology.js and horizon.networktopology.js. They needs to be clean up at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-09 19:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-09 19:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Now it gets more complicated.

Shall I also remove translation of "Open Console" from po file?
i.e. openstack_dashboard/locale/ja/LC_MESSAGES/djangojs.po'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-10 07:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Shall I also remove translation of "Open Console" from po file?
> i.e. openstack_dashboard/locale/ja/LC_MESSAGES/djangojs.po

There is no need to change translations. They will be updated automatically once a fix is merged into the repository.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-10 09:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Akihiro-san, thanks for the answer.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-11-14 16:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-14 17:00:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Generally looks good.

the following line in network_topology.utils.get_context is unnecessary as well.

  context['console_type'] = getattr(settings, 'CONSOLE_TYPE', 'AUTO')"}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-14 20:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-15 04:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-15 04:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

I added a release note on this. This is a scaling issue so I believe it is worth having a release note.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-15 05:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

very dissappointing. i primarily get to the console this way since it is so convient

Any chance of making this configurable instead of dropping it entirely?'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-15 07:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi Sam,

there is a scalability reason behind this patch. You could find the discussion in https://launchpad.net/bugs/1723142.

Actually you don't miss the possibility to the open the console link.
Just one more click. In the network topology page, click "View Instance Details" in the instance balloon, you would get the console tab of the instance.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Hi Sam,
 > 
 > there is a scalability reason behind this patch. You could find the
 > discussion in https://launchpad.net/bugs/1723142.
 > 
 > Actually you don't miss the possibility to the open the console
 > link.
 > Just one more click. In the network topology page, click "View
 > Instance Details" in the instance balloon, you would get the
 > console tab of the instance.

I understand the scalability issue, and the "just one more click" is actually two more clicks and it navigates me away from the network topology page ratherthan being a pop up.

It does not scale to thousands of instances, sure. but the average deploy does not have thousands of instances.

I am far from the only one who uses the network topology page like this. Is there no way to make this optional rather than just rip it out? Perhaps even something a bit more dynamic like disable fetching the console link if there n number of instances.'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-16 07:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi Sam,
 
 > I understand the scalability issue, and the "just one more click"
 > is actually two more clicks and it navigates me away from the
 > network topology page ratherthan being a pop up.
 > 
 > It does not scale to thousands of instances, sure. but the average
 > deploy does not have thousands of instances.
 
In our setup, we have 200+ instances in the project, and have already felt the pain of slowness (The page just timed out).

 > I am far from the only one who uses the network topology page like
 > this. Is there no way to make this optional rather than just rip it
 > out? Perhaps even something a bit more dynamic like disable
 > fetching the console link if there n number of instances.

Of course a bit more dynamic like patch would be welcomed, although console link of instance in the network topology page doesn't sound right to me.

I believe in the end, the core member of horizon project should make the call, or we just vote? Nevertheless, I'm not sure about the process.

Thanks for your opinion!'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-16 23:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I understand the motivation behind the patch. And I agree with it. But I would vote to solve this in a different way than removing part of someones workflow without proper deprecation/warning. As would my friends and colleagues in operations.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-17 15:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Sam, does it work for you if we change the URL of "Open Console" with the "Console" tab of the server detail?'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-17 17:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Sam, does it work for you if we change the URL of "Open Console"
 > with the "Console" tab of the server detail?

If that page loaded as a pop-up, that would keep the workflow about the same, yes.'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2017-11-18 05:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> > Sam, does it work for you if we change the URL of "Open Console"
 > > with the "Console" tab of the server detail?
 > 
 > If that page loaded as a pop-up, that would keep the workflow about
 > the same, yes.

It's probably the best to drop the "Open Console" link and have the "View Instance Details" link open the instance details panel in a new tab, which I think it's better than a pop-up(a new window).'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-22 12:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> It's probably the best to drop the "Open Console" link and have the
 > "View Instance Details" link open the instance details panel in a
 > new tab, which I think it's better than a pop-up(a new window).

I'll adjust my patch.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-23 10:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-24 20:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-11-26 21:08:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-30 01:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Sam, are you okay with the new approach? We are waiting for your feedback.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-30 11:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I noticed another approach. https://review.openstack.org/524149
My approach does not change GUI design at all and calculates a console link when a user actually access the console by clicking "Open Console". Thought?'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-11-30 14:38:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> I noticed another approach. https://review.openstack.org/524149
 > My approach does not change GUI design at all and calculates a
 > console link when a user actually access the console by clicking
 > "Open Console". Thought?

Hi Akihiro,

thanks for your patch!

As I expressed in the IRC, short term, making the console link dynamically generated is Ok; long term, we should get rid of it.

A link of instance + another link of console of instance feel surplus, my opinion.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-30 15:18:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Sam, are you okay with the new approach? We are waiting for your
 > feedback.

I know its a small detail and im trying very hard to not be difficult here, but not having the console directly available from the network topology page is going to be a pretty big work disruption. So im still not happy with this change, but im not going to fight it if thats what a majority of people want.

I would much prefer the autognerated link to remove the overhead of needing to fetch console links every refresh.'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2017-11-30 22:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> > Sam, are you okay with the new approach? We are waiting for your
 > > feedback.
 > 
 > I know its a small detail and im trying very hard to not be
 > difficult here, but not having the console directly available from
 > the network topology page is going to be a pretty big work
 > disruption. So im still not happy with this change, but im not
 > going to fight it if thats what a majority of people want.
 > 
 > I would much prefer the autognerated link to remove the overhead of
 > needing to fetch console links every refresh.

The console is available on the instance details panel, so you can still access the console directly from the network topology panel. What am I missing here?'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-30 23:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Workflow changes. As I stated before, accessing the instance console from the network topology directly is extremly convient and was used heavily by myself in others in operations. Having to click through multiple links to get to the console is more cumbersome. I dont see a good reason to remove it when there are other options that achieve the same goals (performance improvements).'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2017-12-01 03:30:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Workflow changes. As I stated before, accessing the instance
 > console from the network topology directly is extremly convient and
 > was used heavily by myself in others in operations. Having to click
 > through multiple links to get to the console is more cumbersome. I
 > dont see a good reason to remove it when there are other options
 > that achieve the same goals (performance improvements).

I think the open console link is redundant since you can access the console with the view details link, but I am fine with keeping it for your request.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-12-01 04:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Thanks for that. I am not trying to cause problems here. I am simply stating other operators and myself have used it in the past.

We do try to avoid using the console in the instance page and instead use the direct link to the console due to know issues with novnc and not having focus to recieve keyboard inputs without clicking on the frame first.

I appreicate you all hearing me out and working with me :)'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-12-01 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Ying and Sam,

I think for the moment, we could have a look first at the patch which Akihiro provided (auto generated console link). https://review.openstack.org/524149

My patch could be put on hold.

Regards,
Chenjun'}, {'account_id': 25591, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:45:35.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 months without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
Drop the "Open Console" link from the instance's ballon

As the call for a console link is a very expensive operation.
Sequentially getting links of all valid instances takes a lot
of computation time. So we decide to remove the "Open Console"
link in the network topology page.

Meanwhile, "View Instance Details" link has been changed to
be opened in a new window/tab. Where you could easily find
the console tab of the instance.

Change-Id: I8af55508026d8e247c40248486bb1ae0015cf460
Closes-Bug: 1723142

commit_message:
Do not redirect to the /identity tab admin users on login.

The /identity url may have more resources than project page so it loads slowly.
We can improve user experience by setting different login url.

Change-Id: I6ce91974d101d80e9685826dc4e6a6495e6a5da3
Closes-Bug: #1778006
(cherry picked from commit 9b6b559eca9822fa887f7cac6b051be126c1d22f)

[{'created': '2016-04-08 21:39:45.000000000', 'message': 'Legacy Transfer Table is now themable.

Change-Id: Ie32d591816c4988011fcd634a85df919e0cb12e2
'}, {'created': '2016-04-11 19:25:14.000000000', 'message': 'Legacy Transfer Table is now themable.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Change-Id: Ie32d591816c4988011fcd634a85df919e0cb12e2
'}, {'created': '2016-04-12 22:30:59.000000000', 'message': 'Legacy Transfer Table is now themable.

The legacy transfer table (the membership table) was being using in
the update member dialog of the identity/projects panel was using
a lot of hardcoded styles.  A fake-table was implemented to help with
layout, but was actually unnecessary, since Bootstrap list groups are
the perfect UI widget for this experience.  Replaced a LOT of custom
scss/html with standard Bootstrap (rows, columns, list groups).

It proved to be difficult to augment any of the markup because the
JavaScript was relying on very very specific markup.  This was
corrected and the JavaScript was also updated to make use of caching
selectors.  Much of the overcomplicated logic (adding styling, etc)
was cleaned up.

Admin -> System -> Metadata Definitions -> Update Associations was
relying on this old styling.  This template was also updated to use
standard Bootstrap markup.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

Change-Id: Ie32d591816c4988011fcd634a85df919e0cb12e2

corrected and the JavaScript was also updated to make use of caching
selectors.  Much of the overcomplicated logic (adding styling, etc)
was cleaned up.

Admin -> System -> Metadata Definitions -> Update Associations was
relying on this old styling.  This template was also updated to use
standard Bootstrap markup.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

commit_message:
Legacy Transfer Table should inherit from theme

The legacy transfer table (the membership table) was being using in
the update member dialog of the identity/projects panel was using
a lot of hardcoded styles.  A fake-table was implemented to help with
layout, but was actually unnecessary, since Bootstrap list groups are
the perfect UI widget for this experience.  Replaced a LOT of custom
scss/html with standard Bootstrap (rows, columns, list groups).

It proved to be difficult to augment any of the markup because the
JavaScript was relying on very very specific markup.  This was
corrected and the JavaScript was also updated to make use of caching
selectors.  Much of the overcomplicated logic (adding styling, etc)
was cleaned up.

Admin -> System -> Metadata Definitions -> Update Associations was
relying on this old styling.  This template was also updated to use
standard Bootstrap markup.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

Change-Id: Ie32d591816c4988011fcd634a85df919e0cb12e2

[{'created': '2018-05-31 14:13:34.000000000', 'message': "Retrieve password when the key is protected

When the private key is crypted with a passphrase, horizon is unable to decrypt

A new input has been added to the form and with the jsrsasign lib, the private

Change-Id: I6866973e4a6b1548b50c63d0bad132adb6bfb80a

commit_message:
Retrieve password when the key is protected

When the private key is crypted with a passphrase, horizon is unable to decrypt
it.
A new input has been added to the form and with the jsrsasign lib, the private
key can be read and used to decript the VM's password
Closes-Bug: #1632353

Change-Id: I6866973e4a6b1548b50c63d0bad132adb6bfb80a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 20:59:54.000000000', 'message': 'import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ic86f06aa22934bcc7442dbdf9e2e27169d1ecaf2
Story: #2002586
Task: #24760
'}]
commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ic86f06aa22934bcc7442dbdf9e2e27169d1ecaf2
Story: #2002586
Task: #24760

commit_message:
Fix the stable queens ci test failed

1. What is the problem?

we need move quees to run with the python3. so we can

update from queens. but right now the queens ci can

not pass.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

fix the ci test errors.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

No new features.

Change-Id: I2668651004e2dfec854b66c21aebf3269f34161e

commit_message:
OCP-Router - Fix Ingress controller LB listener creation

After the changes done at LBaaS driver to support
namespace network isolation Ingress controller fails to
create/ensure Listener for the L7 Router LB.

This patch fixes this issue, and also update ingress controller
code to retrieve L7 router's LB details in the context of
the working thread.

Closes-Bug: 1787883

Change-Id: Ia63785bdc9018f8ecd3ad820bb484f34c48e9569

commit_message:
PodVIFDriver impl - fix release_vif() signature

Some of the implementations of PodVIFDriver do not have the project_id
and security_groups parameters, resulting in runtime exceptions if these
drivers are used with handlers that expect base class signature to be
followed.

Change-Id: Id1972e02f71238771062cdebec37a3a8a22d768b
Closes-Bug: 1787918
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 13:36:35.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid release_vif race when using namespaces and pools

If ports pools and namespace isolation features are enabled together
it may happen that namespace object gets deleted before the vif handler
on_delete function gets executed, leading to a ResourceNotReady
exception raised by the namespace security group driver when trying
to get the kuryrnet crd annotated on the (deleted) namespace object.

This patch ensure if that happens, the vif handler can still complete
the on_deleted function, releasing the vif by using an empty security
group list as the ports are going to be deleted anyway with the rest
of the namespace related OpenStack resources.

Closes-Bug: 1787951
Change-Id: I19a8f89fb13de1b43e2f6178b6b0261f5dde7990
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid release_vif race when using namespaces and pools

If ports pools and namespace isolation features are enabled together
it may happen that namespace object gets deleted before the vif handler
on_delete function gets executed, leading to a ResourceNotReady
exception raised by the namespace security group driver when trying
to get the kuryrnet crd annotated on the (deleted) namespace object.

This patch ensure if that happens, the vif handler can still complete
the on_deleted function, releasing the vif by using an empty security
group list as the ports are going to be deleted anyway with the rest
of the namespace related OpenStack resources.

Closes-Bug: 1787951
Change-Id: I19a8f89fb13de1b43e2f6178b6b0261f5dde7990

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 15:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ports pool are not duplicated with kuryr-controller HA

Due to ports pool being on kuryr-controller memory, there is a need
for sync-ing the pools when a kuryr-controller becomes the active
controller, otherwise pools created by the previous active controller
will not be used and new ports will be created. This patch ensures
the kuryr-controller triggers a ports pool recovery action when
transitioning to the active controller

TODO:
- Add tests

Closes-Bug: 1787595
Change-Id: I8ee48f8cf4afad2338ae7a3b55b99ce46910ad70

commit_message:
Ensure ports pool are not duplicated with kuryr-controller HA

Due to ports pool being on kuryr-controller memory, there is a need
for sync-ing the pools when a kuryr-controller becomes the active
controller, otherwise pools created by the previous active controller
will not be used and new ports will be created. This patch ensures
the kuryr-controller triggers a ports pool recovery action when
transitioning to the active controller

Closes-Bug: 1787595
Change-Id: I8ee48f8cf4afad2338ae7a3b55b99ce46910ad70

commit_message:
Remove use_mox directive

As of horizon 14.0.0.0b2 or later the use_mox directive is unecessary
so we can remove it.

Additionally:
* Drop mox3 from test-requirements.txt
* raise lower bound for Horizon (due to mox3 removal)

Change-Id: Ibcdd5fcda789a4038a538b19d09bc87cdc6fe7f3
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 20:43:03.000000000', 'message': 'Change neutron grafana dashboard to 2-column format

The new layout for the Neutron grafana dashboard expresses results in
sets of two: first the rate of failure, then the number of jobs.  But
the display we had been using was formatted for 3 columns, which meant
things did not line up.  I experimented using the "older release"
neutron dashboards with increasing the span from 4 to 6, which resizes
from three columns to 2.  This means that all of the failure rate graphs
are in one column, and all the job count graphs are in a second column,
for easy comparison.  This change implements the 2-column format for the
main neutron dashboard.

Here are links so you can compare the format:

Main dashboard: http://grafana.openstack.org/d/Hj5IHcSmz/neutron-failure-rate?orgId=1
Older dashboard: http://grafana.openstack.org/d/pM54U-Kiz/neutron-failure-rate-previous-stable-release?orgId=1

Change-Id: I51d7f9ae895cf7ef4caace5a74cf66f78e3581cf
'}]
commit_message:
Change neutron grafana dashboard to 2-column format

The new layout for the Neutron grafana dashboard expresses results in
sets of two: first the rate of failure, then the number of jobs.  But
the display we had been using was formatted for 3 columns, which meant
things did not line up.  I experimented using the "older release"
neutron dashboards with increasing the span from 4 to 6, which resizes
from three columns to 2.  This means that all of the failure rate graphs
are in one column, and all the job count graphs are in a second column,
for easy comparison.  This change implements the 2-column format for the
main neutron dashboard.

Here are links so you can compare the format:

Main dashboard: http://grafana.openstack.org/d/Hj5IHcSmz/neutron-failure-rate?orgId=1
Older dashboard: http://grafana.openstack.org/d/pM54U-Kiz/neutron-failure-rate-previous-stable-release?orgId=1

Change-Id: I51d7f9ae895cf7ef4caace5a74cf66f78e3581cf

commit_message:
Fix a failure to format config sample

A help string of 'enable_consoleauth' is missing
in nova/conf/workarounds.py.
So formatting sample for enable_consoleauth is failed.

This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Iad799099028f15948733451556207e7a77c1517b
Closes-Bug: #1789800

commit_message:
Remove useless parameter default_flavor

Default flavor to use for the EC2 API only.
The Nova API does not support a default flavor.

Change-Id: Ic731fe84d650fa60be5f2cad4af580446dbb79af

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 08:57:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove os_compute_api:os-config-drive

Nova API extension concept has been removed in Pike. Those
extensions have their own policies enforcement. As there is
no extensions now, "os_compute_api:os-config-drive"
policy which was added for extensions is not needed any more.

Change-Id: Id112196edcf632c4c67d4b5a431d01107ce7c9da
'}, {'created': '2018-06-20 05:24:25.000000000', 'message': 'Remove os_compute_api:os-config-drive

Nova API extension concept has been removed in Pike. Those
extensions have their own policies enforcement. As there is
no extensions now, "os_compute_api:os-config-drive"
policy which was added for extensions is not needed any more.

Change-Id: Id112196edcf632c4c67d4b5a431d01107ce7c9da
'}]
commit_message:
Remove os_compute_api:os-config-drive

Nova API extension concept has been removed in Pike. Those
extensions have their own policies enforcement. As there is
no extensions now, "os_compute_api:os-config-drive"
policy which was added for extensions is not needed any more.

Change-Id: Id112196edcf632c4c67d4b5a431d01107ce7c9da

commit_message:
Added tests for the ssh action

Check two cases:
* access with wrong credentials
* access with correct credentials. The user is created during
`run_tests.sh` execution.

Change-Id: Icbe611d1bff58a1cbfae09bffe6113c3fe5f6804
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Add support for dnf

In order to run this on python3 and fedora, we need to use the dnf
module or use package.

Change-Id: I9f61facd0165f67af18018dff363a8e2075f3aee
Related-Blueprint: dnf-support

[{'created': '2018-08-17 13:44:32.000000000', 'message': 'Doc: PowerVM does support shelve

Corrects the support matrix to indicate that PowerVM supports
shelve/unshelve. Shelve only requires a driver to support power_off
and snapshot, both of which the PowerVM driver has implemented.

Change-Id: Iec56a2a61e90d3d97468b1d7f72a0b28975e6cd1
'}]
commit_message:
Doc: PowerVM does support shelve

Corrects the support matrix to indicate that PowerVM supports
shelve/unshelve. Shelve only requires a driver to support power_off
and snapshot, both of which the PowerVM driver has implemented.

Change-Id: Iec56a2a61e90d3d97468b1d7f72a0b28975e6cd1

commit_message:
Fix incorrect log resources querying

This patch aims to fix a co-existence problem between security_group
and firewall_group log resources due to incorrect log querying from
database.

Change-Id: Ic60ad436e0fbb23cdae0e63eaeb73130ebf02089
Closes-Bug: #1787119
(Cherry-picked from commit 310bfa326fb9c016d02f9a505ae309ae0e15e7d4)

following naming policy.

commit_message:
Don't use '_TransactionContextManager._async'

In commit 2d532963, all instances of 'async' were replaced with 'async_'
in preparation for Python 3.7. However, one of these should not have
been changed as it refers to an oslo.db object attribute. That attribute
has actually been renamed itself but that rename is only present from
oslo.db 4.40.0 [1]. Thankfully, an alias to the older name is provided
so we use that.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/commit/df6bf34

Change-Id: I1afd0ba34a9ebcb63edb91e880ef60580befb32e
Closes-Bug: #1788833
(cherry picked from commit bd7d991309ea2bea5d175cb1f2710519936fd0c2)

commit_message:
Update list of skipped bandit plugins

This is the same fix as https://review.openstack.org/592884

commit_message:
Fix regex for python paunch package in repo config

The paunch package is named python2-paunch or python3-paunch, so we need to
update the regex to python*-paunch* to cover all paunch rpms.

Change-Id: Icc0dbcdb6ac5150b4187f9d1fa651e3bb9c54355

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 14:10:27.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I3a0c5e287729ae7fc34f95be1e23995142c0b6fb
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I3a0c5e287729ae7fc34f95be1e23995142c0b6fb

[{'created': '2018-08-03 14:52:14.000000000', 'message': 'fix pep8 check and made it generic

Remove file pattern from pep8 job which prevented
it from running on most changes.

Rename pep8 job to linters whichi is more generic and
allows us to stack any number of linters without having

commit_message:
replace pep8 check with generic linters

Includes removal of file pattern from pep8 job which prevented
it from running on most changes. Linters will use multiple tools
and a pattern would make it fail to spot errors.

This check should run even if no files are changed, so it would
be able to check commit messages.

There are no real load implications because linters check is
just a simple tox execution which has minimal resource requirements.

Includes reactivaction or linting which was not running on
the entire repository. This required few minor fixes.

Partial-Bug: #1786286
Change-Id: I4d4279309af55c2663e98bd0cdec9224f03c1fa0

commit_message:
Add another level of parent jobs for zuul v3

Add parent jobs (based off tripleo-ci-base) for
multinode, ovb, singlenode and standlone.
This will allow child jobs to override the playbooks
and tags defined.

 - add new parent jobs: multinode, ovb, singlenode and standlone
 - reparent jobs definitions
 - remove include_vars for environment_type
 - remove playbooks/tripleo-ci/vars/environment_type

Change-Id: Ib05797303e2775284125af8fbfb875676f1eaf78

commit_message:
Enable ES 5 test job

Modifies test-setup.sh to look for an environment variable
USE_ES_5; if set, installs elasticsearch 5.2.2 otherwise sticks
with 2.3.2.

elastic.co changed the location of elasticsearch tarballs
from 2.x to 5.x; this change allows the devstack plugin
to honor ES 2.x and ES 5.x properly.

Change-Id: I3dcde6608fd6422c1662c6ea997b2c56dfa72191
Implements-blueprint: add-es-5-test-job

commit_message:
Passwords mismatches when using custom plan env

Passwords are differed when using custom plan environment with
-p or --plan-environment-file option during plan update.
Passwords are loaded from environment file when updating plan
with custom plan environment file.
Need to update the logic to invoke load passwords when using
custom plan environment file also.

Change-Id: Ic206351ced77088f70e9e1fc25270b2c097b349b
Closes-Bug: #1790580
(cherry picked from commit 764a5a65b08bd1f9c22e25866025c191725c11ac)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-29 14:09:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix gateway's router port marked as DOWN

This patch is fixing a problem which left the external/gateway's router
port with status DOWN even after the port was bound to a chassis.

Since the Logical_Router_Port table in OVNNB does not have a "up" column
(like the Logical_Switch_Port table has) the status of those ports can
not be updpated based on it. Therefore, this patch uses the "chassis"
column for that. If the router port has the "chassis" column in OVNNB
database set, the binding and status ACTIVE will be set in Neutron
otherwise it status will be udpated to DOWN (if it's not DOWN yet).

Closes-Bug: #1715126
Change-Id: I91026204eae6df18be47df02f99db2f95c428e2b

commit_message:
Fix gateway's router port marked as DOWN

This patch is fixing a problem which left the external/gateway's router
port with status DOWN even after the port was bound to a chassis.

Since the Logical_Router_Port table in OVNNB does not have a "up" column
(like the Logical_Switch_Port table has) the status of those ports can
not be updpated based on it. Therefore, this patch uses the "chassis"
column for that. If the router port has the "chassis" column in OVNNB
database set, the binding and status ACTIVE will be set in Neutron
otherwise it status will be udpated to DOWN (if it's not DOWN yet).

Closes-Bug: #1715126
Change-Id: I91026204eae6df18be47df02f99db2f95c428e2b

Consolidate irrelevant files added for py3 project

The autogenerated changes for the python3-first project duplicate
tempest-irrelevant-files, which was previously consolidated in [1].
This reconsolidates them.

subject: Remove poll_end
messages:
[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-29 23:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-08-30 09:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thinking about it, I believe I prefer "poll_end" to "election_end" for the general case, as a matter of clarity.  What do others think?'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-30 23:55:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't really mind.  I was trying to reduce duplication.  I s'pose it costs us very little to leave it there and if we placed any in the code duplicates in the code next to each other we'd be less likely to change one and leave the others and introduce an inconsistency.

This makes me think we probably want a ci job to generate all the emails and make sure the code is functional if not correct.  I'll add that to the end of the series."}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-09-04 10:51:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm convinced by this patch: we should consider changing the names of the content of the config file separately in the future: this isn't the place to do half of that."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-09-05 01:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-09-05 02:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-09-05 23:30:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for cleaning that up.'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-09-05 01:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-09-05 02:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-09-05 23:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLooks fine to me.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 01:04:43.000000000', 'message': "Add last_release to the tc_fmt_args dict()

In tc_nominations_kickoff() we need to refer to the most recent release
which we did correctly in Icf1274ebc957e8b74fa35c0f0c791ae22f079b16 but
when we merged all the fmt args in
I8b439c76fa1d14624c0119ab05b1561c6cf424c9 we didn't noticed that
'future_release' is used differently in tc_nominations_kickoff().

This last introduces a new 'last_release' key that differs from
end_release only in case :(

Change-Id: I02f1e6a9cfa1a6e327f6d463723ec67bf0f873e5
"}]
commit_message:
Add last_release to the tc_fmt_args dict()

In tc_nominations_kickoff() we need to refer to the most recent release
which we did correctly in Icf1274ebc957e8b74fa35c0f0c791ae22f079b16 but
when we merged all the fmt args in
I8b439c76fa1d14624c0119ab05b1561c6cf424c9 we didn't noticed that
'future_release' is used differently in tc_nominations_kickoff().

This last introduces a new 'last_release' key that differs from
end_release only in case :(

Change-Id: I02f1e6a9cfa1a6e327f6d463723ec67bf0f873e5

messages:
[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-29 23:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-08-30 09:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This is fine to merge as-is, but I wonder if it might make sense to have a general set of fmt_args, which is then extended to provide a tc_fmt_args and a ptl_fmt_args, to take advantage of cases where we use the same data for both.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-30 23:52:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This is fine to merge as-is, but I wonder if it might make sense to
 > have a general set of fmt_args, which is then extended to provide a
 > tc_fmt_args and a ptl_fmt_args, to take advantage of cases where we
 > use the same data for both.

That's the plan but I'd rather do that after we do implement the PTL templating side of things.  I kinda think it'll end up looking like:

 fmt_args = dict(<All the common items>)
 ptl_fmt_args = dict(<PTL specific items>).update(**fmt_args)
 tc_fmt_args = dict(<TC specific items>).update(**fmt_args)

but I'm fickle and may decide that's ugly once I see it in context ;P"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-09-05 01:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-09-05 02:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28239, 'date': '2018-09-05 03:38:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-09-05 23:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Much more efficient. Makes sense to me.'}]

commit_message:
Only generate one set of data for the TC emails

Instead of generating fmt_args specifically for each message combine all
the per-function instances in a global tc_fmt_args.  This makes finding
duplicates easier.

Change-Id: I8b439c76fa1d14624c0119ab05b1561c6cf424c9

commit_message:
Simplify tc_nominations_kickoff

voting_{start_end} are aliases for election_{start,end} and
end_nomination{,s} are the same thing so simplify the args the print
function.

Change-Id: I63ed2d5d75725efa775d443362bf8677947caf06

commit_message:
Get tc_nominations_kickoff data from the config

Use the data in the config to supply the details for the
tc_nominations_kickoff email.  Also switch the printing to use keywords
to make it clear what's going where.

Change-Id: Icf1274ebc957e8b74fa35c0f0c791ae22f079b16

commit_message:
Update template_emails to be a functional tool

At this point 'functional' just means compiles and runs without doing
anything.  We'll update it to have a UI as we update the various emails

Change-Id: I812f5737cb81d657f2b299122bd2337130213590

Update requirements

We use jinja in our docs builds and those functions are going to be used
more widely so lets make it clear we need Jinja2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-29 23:54:36.000000000', 'message': 'Python3 by default

commit_message:
Python3 by default

Set all the tox environments to be python3 *except* venv2.
Set the trove data mostly because we can.

Change-Id: Ib65e84c7da16683f70657a3bc8e9b9ccdb8f1c8a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 14:34:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix doc builds for ironic

It seems that the wsme sphinx extension was concealing
issues in our doc builds, where formatting was not exactly
correct nor parsed as we would always expect as we have had
a tendency to fully document data structures as if we are
typing code.

Upon disabling the extension, the prior build failures due to
duplicate labels disappeared and other issues preventing the
docs from building successfully were raised.

It also seems that we never actually used the extension as
documented https://wsme.readthedocs.io/en/latest/document.html

$ grep -ir "wsme:root" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:type" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:attribute" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:service" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autotype" ./ironic
./ironic/objects/fields.py:class FlexibleDictField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
./ironic/objects/fields.py:class MACAddressField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
$ grep -ir "autoattribute" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autoservice" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autofunction" ./ironic
$

Change-Id: Ib5bbd9274a4098022fba69f0e4998485d2ee2396
Story: 2003020
Task:  23043

commit_message:
Fix doc builds for ironic

It seems that the wsme sphinx extension was concealing
issues in our doc builds, where formatting was not exactly
correct nor parsed as we would always expect as we have had
a tendency to fully document data structures as if we are
typing code.

Upon disabling the extension, the prior build failures due to
duplicate labels disappeared and other issues preventing the
docs from building successfully were raised.

It also seems that we never actually used the extension as
documented https://wsme.readthedocs.io/en/latest/document.html

$ grep -ir "wsme:root" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:type" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:attribute" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:service" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autotype" ./ironic
./ironic/objects/fields.py:class FlexibleDictField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
./ironic/objects/fields.py:class MACAddressField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
$ grep -ir "autoattribute" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autoservice" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autofunction" ./ironic
$

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib5bbd9274a4098022fba69f0e4998485d2ee2396
Story: 2003020
Task:  23043

commit_message:
Fixes input validation in angular kepyairs.

Modifies the regexp used by the angular form validation
to match the allowed characters in Nova API as well
as the description thereof.

Change-Id: I5bb1c1cc531565416efbce16994306cb9ad79000
Closes-bug: #1743887

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 12:32:51.000000000', 'message': 'bgpvpn router fallback: override NORMAL in ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE

Bug 1789878 describes why the current implementation of traffic
redirection for router fallback has been defeated by change
Ib6ced838a7ec6d5c459a8475318556001c31bdf which was brought in the neutron
ovs firewalling code.

This change moves the place where we put a higher priority
rule to override the NORMAL action to the ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE,
which is added by I60d299275effd9ef35c8007773d3c9fcabfa50fa to
re-introduce a single table where NORMAL happens for egress traffic.

Change-Id: I8923ca9583b3337556aaf98b4f25732ea6b7bb1c
Depends-On: I60d299275effd9ef35c8007773d3c9fcabfa50fa
Closes-Bug: 1789878
'}, {'created': '2018-08-31 12:34:06.000000000', 'message': 'bgpvpn: override NORMAL action in ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE

commit_message:
bgpvpn: override NORMAL action in ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE

Bug 1789878 describes why the current implementation of traffic
redirection for router fallback has been defeated by change
Ib6ced838a7ec6d5c459a8475318556001c31bdf which was brought in the neutron
ovs firewalling code.

This change moves the place where we put a higher priority
rule to override the NORMAL action to the ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE,
which is added by I60d299275effd9ef35c8007773d3c9fcabfa50fa to
re-introduce a single table where NORMAL happens for egress traffic.

To allow this change to pass the lower-constraints requirement
check job is temporarily set to non-voting, because this job
does not seem to be able to take into account the fact that the
master branch needs neutron master.

Change-Id: I8923ca9583b3337556aaf98b4f25732ea6b7bb1c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598593
Closes-Bug: 1789878

Reproducer, by its name tried to reproduce a specific *build* on a private environment.
This means that it should use the same code as CI.

I can understand why you may want to test with master on an older build BUT this
would be outside the scope of reproducer.

If you want you could implement the "use-master" code as an option CLI argument, still default it should be to reproduce the original build, and not something "new" and undetermined.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-09-02 12:14:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No, Sorin, reproducer must NOT use the same code as CI had, it must be separated completely from CI code and only REPRODUCE CI jobs. [{'created': '2018-09-01 21:58:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "reproducer: cherry pick zuul changes"

commit_message:
Revert "reproducer: cherry pick zuul changes"

This reverts commit c348e84ce1a3411707c02ca08ac606e08339277a.

Local reproducer role should be from master, not from change. If we run
reproducer from a month ago, it will run reproducer role from a month
ago and most likely will fail or will have not up to date settings.
If one want to test changes to reproducer role, it's possible to edit
reproducer script manually.
It doens't make sense to use reproducer code from same data that patch
itself, if reproducer was broken then you just can't run it even now.

Close-Bug: #1790611
Change-Id: Ic699159da53ca6676bf4d1d845816d333893e8ec

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

[{'created': '2018-07-11 08:02:20.000000000', 'message': 'Use new style for help in Angular ModalFormService

ModalFormService (horizon.framework.widgets.form.ModalFormService,
used in create key pair dialog or create user dialog) and WizardModalService
(horizon.framework.widgets.modal.wizard-modal.service, used in create instance
dialog or create image dialog) are used in dialogs for create/edit/etc in Angularized
panel. But their help descriptions are shown in different style.

Angularization proposes new look and feel, so ModalFormService should follow
new style for help description like WizardModalService.

This patch proposes new style for help in dialogs that uses ModalFormService.

Change-Id: Ia720180c7aaef1f3d9c5e24dbebe3fe2d796d6c7

commit_message:
Use new style for help in Angular ModalFormService

ModalFormService (horizon.framework.widgets.form.ModalFormService,
used in create key pair dialog or create user dialog) and WizardModalService
(horizon.framework.widgets.modal.wizard-modal.service, used in create instance
dialog or create image dialog) are used in dialogs for create/edit/etc in Angularized
panel. But their help descriptions are shown in different style.

Angularization proposes new look and feel, so ModalFormService should follow
new style for help description like WizardModalService.

This patch proposes new style for help in dialogs that uses ModalFormService.

And "?" button for opening help panel is overlaped on input field on the first row,
so this patch moves it up little bit.

In this new style, if the help contents is too simple, it is not needed to
make description space in the right harf of dialog for looks consistency,
it is prefer not to add help panel, i.e. simply do not show "?" button.

Change-Id: Ia720180c7aaef1f3d9c5e24dbebe3fe2d796d6c7
Closes-Bug: #1781151

commit_message:
Delete ovs port if namespace is corrupted

This patch isolates a corrupted dhcp
namespace and protects the ovs from being
blasted by thousands of dangling ovs
ports created by dhcp agent.

Change-Id: I80138b3c37f41a18dc488a306768b8e2fa299eda
Closes-bug: #1728642

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I30f3bc0f5b68190f72b015ae5a14251c91eeee42
Story: #2002586
Task: #24304

[{'created': '2018-07-05 06:31:32.000000000', 'message': 'Support py36 for test

Ubuntu Artful and  Fedora 26 already ship Python 3.6 by default
(And Bionic and F28 have been released since then.). Considering
better support of python3 with system, we should enable py36 for test
environment.

You can find some discussion in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131193.html

Change-Id: I0187e862c0b74dbb836d36e7062ccc9e47a51cc2
'}, {'created': '2018-08-29 04:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'Support py36 for test in tox

Ubuntu Artful and  Fedora 26 already ship Python 3.6 by default
(And Bionic and F28 have been released since then.). Considering
better support of python3 with system, we should enable py36 for test
environment.

You can find some discussion in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131193.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597267

Change-Id: I0187e862c0b74dbb836d36e7062ccc9e47a51cc2
'}]
commit_message:
Support py36 for test in tox

Ubuntu Artful and  Fedora 26 already ship Python 3.6 by default
(And Bionic and F28 have been released since then.). Considering
better support of python3 with system, we should enable py36 for test
environment.

You can find some discussion in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131193.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597267

Change-Id: I0187e862c0b74dbb836d36e7062ccc9e47a51cc2

commit_message:
Update requirements and test-requirements

With placement off by itself, the number of python packages required to
make things go shrinks.

This is the set of modules that are imported directly. There are plenty
of transitive dependencies not listed here.

test-requirements.txt also lists some of the optional things (database
drivers) that come up in devstack-based testing situations.

Change-Id: I3eb6aead544d1ef647ad8d94a18382d5fa795aa4

[{'account_id': 29050, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:07:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-09-05 21:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix bug when deleting subnets with revision numbers

We were attempting to delete the revision number for a wrong type
when deleting a subnet. This caused the maintenance task to detect
inconsistencies forever and attempt to fix them with no success.

This patch is fixing the bug and adding converage on functional
tests.

Change-Id: I852a69b81150d2d1afb39bed542ca776548ea114
Closes-Bug: #1790659
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 52d22da487afb1800c53c3d0b43d5efec036fc24)

commit_message:
Ceph provisioners: Make configmap and job names configurable

This is to make sure configmap and job names will not get conflict
if we are trying to activate any nameapce for two diffrent
ceph cluster's client keys

Change-Id: I8360f642a6d25f2af0d7aaea686adefef838821a
